His Injuries were a closed head injury, frontal skull fracture from ear to ear and fractured sinus bone on the left side of his face that was not repairable, a concussion, High frequency hearing loss in both ears, broke bones in his left hand, that required two surgeries and a titanium plate and screws to put back together and months of therapy to get back to be able to use it and still cannot fully close his hand all the way. But He was not able to go back to work in the same field as he was in and he had to learn a whole new trade. Now his medical bills totaled over $280,000 and even though we had a great attorney the state cap on a workmanâ€™s comp accident was $5,000 but they offered him $17,000 so we took it. So we are still trying to pay on the bills and loans we had to take out in order to make it while he wasnâ€™t working and that leads us to the next part of this storyâ€¦â€¦.


Now that I have gotten you up to speed on the wreck situation I will tell you a bit about us wanting a baby or two. I had a partial hysterectomy on May 20, 2004 just 8 days before Todd and I met ... I had been married twice before my first husband died in a house fire and my second husband nearly killed me and the children (Just two weeks after my youngest that was 3 yrs. old at the time had heart surgery to put a pacemaker in) and he is currently sitting in Mississippi prison. So I had 2 children by each marriage and Todd knew this when we got married and we once we were married we began to put money away out of each paycheck to begin saving for a surrogate mother to carry our baby (embryo - my egg and his sperm ) but after the wreck the little bit of money that we had in savings had to be used to live on while he was out of work and now we have tried to get back on our feet and get the funds back up but we just can't seem to be able to. I have researched the cost and it is a min of $30,000 for a surrogate mom to carry our child plus the hospital bill for the delivery so that is why our goal is set at $51,000 I understand times are hard but if just 51,000 people would donate just $1 we could have our dream and give this selfless man a gift of his own ( a biological child ) He was so selfless coming into this marriage knowing that we would not be able to have children the normal way but now even the dream we had of having a child has been taken from us. This is why I have come here to ask of you all to help us to achieve that goal. 

You can follow our journey as it unfolds on our Facebook page so each person that donates to our cause can follow the story and know that the money you share from your heart will be used for this process only. I would love for nothing more than to give my husband the thing he desires most and that is to become a "dad" As my youngest was 5yrs old when Todd and I met. Thank you for your time in reading this story of our life and thank you in advance for your donation to help fund our dream of being parents. If any of you want to see pictures of the wrecked truck that he was in and the truck that hit him and pictures of him after he was out of NICU and in a regular room or follow us just follow this link to our Facebook page that was created for this journey. Here is the link .... http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=10000328... 

If for some reason we do not raise the whole amount of money it takes to pay for the surrogate and the delivery of our baby, our next choice will be to take the funds raised to adopt a newborn baby. I believe our goal will be met because Todd is a selfless man and He loves unconditionally and I know our Lord will reward that and we will met or exceed our goal and be blessed with our miracle. I thank all of you for being a part in that, and helping make our dream come true. May the Lore richly bless each of you that donate and those of you who pray for our family as well.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. i'm Dave. I love the game of golf. My friends and I have created a unique way of helping golfers improve their game with automated stat tracking tools. There's several golf apps out there today, but the brutal pain of tracking your golf shots is having to input 5 or 6 options everytime you hit the ball. We've solved this...

Introducing automatic stat tracking. We've created technology that enables us to map golf courses anywhere in the world, defining detailed GPS information about every fairway, green and hazard. Users play golf with our app and with the press of a button or a shake of their device, we auto-detect the shot's position, distance, lie, club used, and more. We take all the work out of stat tracking so the golfer can focus on their game.

  • Introduction to Golfbert: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FXfy2XwaW3E
  • Automated Shot Tracking explained: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nnJhS0RUt64

What We Need & What You Get

Our technology only works because we have maticulously mapped every hole on each golf course. So far, we've hit about 8,000 courses, which is just over half of the United States. We'd love to complete every course on the globe, but we need your help. 

  • We need about $25,000 to complete the rest of the golf courses in the U.S. At that point, we can easily move to other countries with golf enthusiasts and give those people the same great service we're currently providing for people in thre U.S.
  • We've come up with a really valuable service to provide to golfers. We just need a little assistance to be able to complete our data collection. We're not a big company, but we know we have a big idea, and we just want it out there for people to use.
  • We're currently offering all of our services for free. This is a service for the golfer, by the golfer. We want to do something great for golf.

Of course there are operating costs with growing a business. As we grow, we'll be offering even more services to make the game of golf more fun. Once we have a stable system in place, we'll be offering a few premium products and services... you guessed it, those of you who help us out now will be rewarded with many perks and 100% cost-free services as we build them out.

Our goal of $25,000 should help us map every course in the Unted States, but even if we don't reach our goal, anything we raise will go towards this strategy. And if we raise more, we'll hit some more countries!

The Impact

We're changing the way golfers can track their game. The services that exist today are either way too time-consuming, or they are so limiting that they don't give you any real indication of why you are playing better or worse. With our automated statistical analysis, we can provide:

  • Extremely detailed stats covering dozens of categories
  • Stats on the individual golf clubs in your bag
  • Historical shot mapping
  • Golf shot tips before you swing your club
  • And much more.

Sample golf course map: http://golfbert.com/courses/George_W_Dunne_National_Golf_Course/8428:Hole_18

Sample stats profile: http://golfbert.com/profiles/samplegolfer?tab=s...

I recently spent over a decade helping to build the powerful sports network Rivals.com, which was acquired by Yahoo! Inc. in 2007. We grew this community-focused subscription network into a hugely successful business over just a few years. As Creative Director, I oversaw the user experience model and headed the product development strategies. We were customer-focused then, and that's how I plan to implement these products as well.

I have also managed the user experience for Golf Channel's SwingFix, a video-based golf instruction service, and 247Sports.com, a community-driven sports network focused on mobile platforms. In addition to these endeavors, I have extensive experience in the industry including Yahoo! and Amazon.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute to our financial goals. If you like the sound of what we're building, please share our story on your favorite social media platform and help us get the word out. We're really excitied to be building this for the golf commnity. We just need a little assistance to reach our goal faster!

 

Dave Lester

Founder and CEO

dave@golfbert.com

story:
Help Us Raise Money for Our Mama

 

Our Mom, Marie, is also a wife, daughter, sister, and grandmommy, and was diagnosed with Stage 4 Metastatic Breast Cancer.

Metastatic, means that it's spreading. And Stage 4, means--that it's time to get REAL. And by Real, we mean Serious.

Our experience with some Doctors when they've found out it's stage 4, have said things like, "Well since it's stage 4, lets go ahead and just try to make you comfortable for the time you have left."

Comforting...isn't it?

We didn't know how serious Cancer was until our Mom was diagnosed. We'd heard stories and read up on it some, but it was all pretty general. We didn't know that Breast Cancer is growing at alarmingly fast rates and that we had any power over preventing it or possibly even healing our bodies. 

Our Mama, Marie has been NOTHING short of amazing throughout her whole journey...

She is a fighter and survivor and we know she will beat this!

Her example of courage, unwavering faith, determination, and positivity 

have truly been an astounding, encouraging, & downright incredible thing to witness!

 

We are proud to call Marie OUR AMAZING Mamacita/Mama-Bear & we believe she deserves the best treatment & care there is and we are determined to do everything we can to achieve that.

But we need your help.

She is receiving Integrative Treament but unfortunately most of the treatment is not covered by insurance. 

Our family has completely exhausted all funds to pay for Mom's treatment.

So now, we are reaching out & Asking for help. 

 

Mama lives in South Carolina and needs to travel across the country to Reno, NV to receive her treatment, where she will stay for several weeks.

 

If you can't help with financial assistance, there is still more you can do.

You can donate SKYMILES.

Or Hotel Points, or any type of Transportation.

 

You can help us get the word out and make some noise about Marie's Fight for her Life. 

You can also donate on our website

www.PeaceLoveAndCancer.com  

(complete with Blogs, Vegan & Vegetarian Recipes, and Resources, in hopes to empower cancer patients and educate others on Integrative Therapies)

AND

 

We have some INCREDIBLE Auction ITEMS up for Grabs!!!

To make a BID on the Auction Items go to:

PEACELOVEANDCANCER.COM

 

AND

You can download Mama's Song by Annie Elie by clicking HERE

OR

You can shout about it from the rooftops (but we're not sure how much that will do) except for maybe annoy your neighbors... 

 

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

We live in an incredible era of Social Media.

Between Facebook, Twitter, Pintrest, Myspace (Well...does anyone still get on myspace anymore? ;), and Email- this is the quickest way to spread the word. 

 

And if you can't do anything else...

 

Please send Prayers and Positive Thoughts and Good Vibes.

 

Mom is a woman of Faith and we are believing that God is going to heal her and she will go on to live an incredible life with an Amazing Testimony to share and impact others. We believe in MIRACLES!

Any and all help is incredibly appreciated.

 

 

With Soo Much Love and Gratitude,

 

Noel, Greg, Annie, and Elijah 

aka The 4 Cubbies/ Team Sassy Britches Cancer Warriors

We wear all our heels, sass it up, and will show that cancer who's boss!

And yes, even the boys wear high-heels in this scenario.

What can we say, we love our mama. :]

story:
What is the inspiration for the High 5 Running Club (H5RC)?

We at the High 5 Running Club (H5RC) love to run but hate the fact that it's often such a solitary activity. We want to make running more social by connecting individuals through the simple medium of the "High 5".

With its roots in London, New York, and California we hope the High 5 Running Club will appeal to all you run- and fun-lovers out there so that we can banish the lonely jog for good.

What we do and how do you get involved...

By buying a High 5 Running Club shirt, the idea is that you throw it on every time you go for a run and that by wearing it, other runners will see the distinctive design and line up to give you what we've found to be the best performance enhancing booster on the right side of the law, a High 5! It's really that simple.

High 5 Running Club Days

To help get the High 5 ball rolling, we are dedicating 1 January 2013 as our first official "High 5 Running Club Day". We will be arranging five High 5 Running Club Days each year, each with a separate theme/cause - follow H5RC on Twitter and Facebook to keep up to date with plans for the following events.

On every official High 5 Running Club Day, members of the H5RC will wear one of our shirts out running (no matter where they are in the world) and high five everyone they pass on their runs.

We want to see photos, videos and stories up on the H5RC website so we can see that the word is spreading.

For our first official H5RC day on New Years Day 2013, we hope the joy of the night before will help break down any awkward social barriers and the high 5's will flow naturally!

Thanks...and we hope to see you out there in a H5RC shirt soon!

Thanks for your time and we hope you contribute to our project. IF YOU DO CONTRIBUTE, WE WILL CONTACT YOU DIRECTLY REGARDING SIZING (S, M, L AND XL AVAILABLE). Even if you don't buy one of our shirts we hope you back our idea to make running more social and that you will spread the word to others you know. 

PS: Given the recent devastation, we have decided to donate $5 for every five shirts sold to Hurricane Sandy relief efforts

story:
My Dad, My Best Friend, My Hero

My dad was diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis at the age of 29. For those of you who don't know what that is, it's the inflammation of joints in your body. Rheumatoid Arthritis may occasionally affect the skin, eyes, lungs, heart, blood or nerves. While the exact cause of arthritis is still unknown, some suggest that a virus or bacteria alters the immune system, causing it to attack the joints. That leads to damaging inflammation, and wears down the cartilage. As the cartilage wears down, the space between the bones narrows. If conditions worsen, the bones could rub against each other. It’s a disease that unfortunately affects over a million people in the United States alone.

This is what’s happening to my dad. He’s 54 years old and he’s had Arthroscopic Knee Surgery, both knees replaced, and a Triple Arthodesis (where the 3 main joints of his right hindfoot were fused). I foresee more surgeries in his future, unless this new medication works for him. It’s called Rituxan. Of all the medications he’s tried in the past, this one has helped him the most with just one does. Rituxan is administered through an IV every six months, which is probably why it’s so costly. I wish I had the money he needed to pay for his treatments myself but life does not allow it.

I can’t explain the pain my dad is going through. I can only describe what it's like to see him on his bad days. We take so much for granted. Simple tasks like brushing his teeth or combing his hair seem almost impossible some days. Tying his shoes, putting on a shirt are daunting tasks at times. His elbows, wrists, and shoulders are limiting his movements. I can’t image what it feels like to have your body betray you every day. To take medication that might help with the pain for a few hours but ends up damaging another part of his body. Medication that over time has made him so weak we almost lost him a couple of years ago. Many of you that know my dad, do not know that last part but it’s true.

I’m asking for help on behalf of my dad, my best friend, my hero. I can NOT image my life without him. I hate to see him in so much pain. This fundraiser will only be up for a short time. Even if we don’t meet our goal, any contributions will be a huge help. My dad always wears a smile no matter what how much pain he’s in. Please help me lessen his pain and help him live a semi-normal life.

For more information on Rituxan, visit http://www.rituxan.com

story:
OUR STORY

Alopecia  is an auto immune disease that results in the  loss of hair on the scalp and other areas of the body.  There are three types of Alopecia: Alopecia Areata, Alopecia  Totalis and Alopecia Universalis.  The most common is Alopecia Areata which presents itself as  round, smooth patches of various sized hair loss.  Next is Alopecia Totalis which is identified by  the total loss of hair on the scalp.  And lastly, Alopecia Universalis, which is the rarest form and results in hairloss over the entire body.  To date, there is NO CURE.

Butterflies BBI is a 501c3 non-profit organization which was created to address the needs of children suffering from hair loss due to Alopecia and other medical conditions.  We have a special interest in inner city kids as they are often a group that is overlooked.  At Butterflies, our mission is to help create a sense of normalcy and wellbeing to our children as they deal with their personal illnesses and conditions by providing them with age appropriate high quality hair replacements. We know that parents are busy.  Juggling work, raising a family and caring for each child's individual needs is time consuming.  We recognize the time constraints so, to lighten the load, we do all the legwork to ensure that our clients receive  all the services they deserve.  Some of our services include matching  clients with the  highest quality  hair replacements  and the best stylists, in order to create that natural age appropriate look.  And most importantly, all our services are completely FREE OF CHARGE to clients 18 and under.

What makes Butterflies BBI different, is that we also know life is busy, so to maker life easier, we come to you!  We make home visits and provide transportation to scheduled appointments if needed.  We also work around the schedules of all caregivers.  So, if a mom or a grandma has to leave for work at 6am and will return at 8pm, we can accommodate them with a 5:30am or 8:30pm home visit to complete our application process.  Pretty neat!

The reality of it is that we live in a society where appearance and acceptance in young girls can be a turning point in regards to their self-esteem.  We believe that by helping to restore normalcy to our clients now, while they deal with their personal conditions and illnesses, we can assist in raising their self-esteem which will contribute to a happier more confident future.  In addition to our hair replacement program, our clients can also elect to participate in our Pink Butterflies program which offers self-esteem workshops and healthy eating seminars.  At Butterflies, we truly care about our clients' well-being and enjoy assisting with this part of their journey.

 WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:

Although running a non-profit organization feeds our passion to help children, we do encounter expenses.  The cost of medical wigs can reach upwards of $6000.  We need your help to cover the cost of a  custom medical wig for a young girl who has been living with Alopecia for over 10 years.  She's such a special girl and a great student but has unfortunately been the victim of bullying and harassment due to her condition.  She's also worn traditional wigs which have been removed by other insensitive students in school, because they were not secure enough or customized.  Medical  wigs with suction caps are a better solution as they are custom made to fit securely, which makes them harder to remove and they look more natural.  They also require a lot of time and effort to create.  The steps include taking a mold of the head, creating a hand made unit and  fitting sessions.  This process can take  several weeks and, according to most providers, the costs begin  at $3500 and can reach $6500. 

Your contributions will go toward covering the  total cost of a custom hair replacement and will be completely tax deductible!  Please help us lighten the load of children who are deserving but often underserved.

If our goal is met, we can immediately start the process of fitting this young lady for her much deserved, new medical wig. (A photo of her condition can be seen above but due to confidentiality guidelines, we can not show her face.) All additional funds will go towards providing  traditional hair replacements, caps ,wraps and services to  other clients in need.  Funds are always needed to help us help other children dealing with their conditions.  And remember, all donations are tax deductible.

 

The Impact

In order to truly understand the impact of the services our clients receive, you would have  had to actually witness their transformations.  According to our parents and caregivers, children who have once shied away from enjoying the day to day activities, that we  so often take for granted, have now become active participants in life.  We have seen our girls blossom and look forward to their futures.  No more shying away from get-togethers, we encourage our girls to get out and live!

Thats why we believe it's so important to raise the self-esteem of our clients sooner than later,  and with your help, we can touch each life one girl at a time.  After all, these girls will eventually become adults and with the help of our Pink Butterflies  program, they will be healthy, happy  well balanced members of society.  So in essence, helping them now is creating a brighter future for all of us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute money to this campaign.  If you fit into that category, there are other ways that you can help.

  • Spread the word to everyone you know.  Encourage them to visit our website,(you might just help another young girl in need).
  • If you are a wig maker, designer or stylist contact us at www.BlaqButterflies.com, your services would be greatly appreciated.
  • Shout us out on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram
story_txt:
OUR STORY Alopecia  is an auto immune disease that results in the  loss of hair on the scalp and other areas of the body.  There are three types of Alopecia: Alopecia Areata, Alopecia  Totalis and Alopecia Universalis.  The most common is Alopecia Areata which presents itself as  round, smooth patches of various sized hair loss.  Next is Alopecia Totalis which is identified by  the total loss of hair on the scalp.  And lastly, Alopecia Universalis, which is the rarest form and results in hairloss over the entire body.  To date, there is NO CURE.
Butterflies BBI is a 501c3 non-profit organization which was created to address the needs of children suffering from hair loss due to Alopecia and other medical conditions.  We have a special interest in inner city kids as they are often a group that is overlooked.  At Butterflies, our mission is to help create a sense of normalcy and wellbeing to our children as they deal with their personal illnesses and conditions by providing them with age appropriate high quality hair replacements. We know that parents are busy.  Juggling work, raising a family and caring for each child's individual needs is time consuming.  We recognize the time constraints so, to lighten the load, we do all the legwork to ensure that our clients receive  all the services they deserve.  Some of our services include matching  clients with the  highest quality  hair replacements  and the best stylists, in order to create that natural age appropriate look.  And most importantly, all our services are completely FREE OF CHARGE to clients 18 and under.
What makes Butterflies BBI different, is that we also know life is busy, so to maker life easier, we come to you!  We make home visits and provide transportation to scheduled appointments if needed.  We also work around the schedules of all caregivers.  So, if a mom or a grandma has to leave for work at 6am and will return at 8pm, we can accommodate them with a 5:30am or 8:30pm home visit to complete our application process.  Pretty neat!
The reality of it is that we live in a society where appearance and acceptance in young girls can be a turning point in regards to their self-esteem.  We believe that by helping to restore normalcy to our clients now, while they deal with their personal conditions and illnesses, we can assist in raising their self-esteem which will contribute to a happier more confident future.  In addition to our hair replacement program, our clients can also elect to participate in our Pink Butterflies program which offers self-esteem workshops and healthy eating seminars.  At Butterflies, we truly care about our clients' well-being and enjoy assisting with this part of their journey.
 WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:
Although running a non-profit organization feeds our passion to help children, we do encounter expenses.  The cost of medical wigs can reach upwards of $6000.  We need your help to cover the cost of a  custom medical wig for a young girl who has been living with Alopecia for over 10 years.  She's such a special girl and a great student but has unfortunately been the victim of bullying and harassment due to her condition.  She's also worn traditional wigs which have been removed by other insensitive students in school, because they were not secure enough or customized.  Medical  wigs with suction caps are a better solution as they are custom made to fit securely, which makes them harder to remove and they look more natural.  They also require a lot of time and effort to create.  The steps include taking a mold of the head, creating a hand made unit and  fitting sessions.  This process can take  several weeks and, according to most providers, the costs begin  at $3500 and can reach $6500. 
Your contributions will go toward covering the  total cost of a custom hair replacement and will be completely tax deductible!  Please help us lighten the load of children who are deserving but often underserved.
If our goal is met, we can immediately start the process of fitting this young lady for her much deserved, new medical wig. (A photo of her condition can be seen above but due to confidentiality guidelines, we can not show her face.) All additional funds will go towards providing  traditional hair replacements, caps ,wraps and services to  other clients in need.  Funds are always needed to help us help other children dealing with their conditions.  And remember, all donations are tax deductible.
 
  The Impact
In order to truly understand the impact of the services our clients receive, you would have  had to actually witness their transformations.  According to our parents and caregivers, children who have once shied away from enjoying the day to day activities, that we  so often take for granted, have now become active participants in life.  We have seen our girls blossom and look forward to their futures.  No more shying away from get-togethers, we encourage our girls to get out and live! Thats why we believe it's so important to raise the self-esteem of our clients sooner than later,  and with your help, we can touch each life one girl at a time.  After all, these girls will eventually become adults and with the help of our Pink Butterflies  program, they will be healthy, happy  well balanced members of society.  So in essence, helping them now is creating a brighter future for all of us.
  Other Ways You Can Help We know that not everyone can contribute money to this campaign.  If you fit into that category, there are other ways that you can help.  Spread the word to everyone you know.  Encourage them to visit our website,(you might just help another young girl in need).
If you are a wig maker, designer or stylist contact us at www.BlaqButterflies.com, your services would be greatly appreciated.

Shout us out on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram

story:
Strong Body Whole Heart will be a weekly audio podcast about finding your best self each and every day. We will focus on a variety of topics pertaining to what we like to call “whole body health,” which, simply put, is a healthy mind, body and spirit. Our topics will range from fitness and nutrition to finding your vision to relationships and more. We will also do listener Q&A once a month.

Each weekly session will provide inspiration, motivation, and practical tips along with a good dose of reality and laughs from us. We are going to open up about our own challenges and how we have overcome them or are still working on them.

Strong Body Whole Heart will be a podcast about heart and soul and strength and power and how all of those things go hand in hand to make us who we are. It will help people rise up to honor themselves and stand in their full truth and beauty. 

We are seeking donations to fund the first full year (52 sessions) of Strong Body Whole Heart. The support is needed for technical equipment (microphones, mixer, cables, etc.), website development and hosting, media hosting, and initial advertising so we can start really helping people move into their best lives. If project funding exceeds our original goal, we will use the overage to increase the quality of the production as well as fund more episodes.

Our biggest challenge at this point is overcoming the technical learning curve. Our goal is to have the podcast up and running within 2 months of completion of our Kickstarter campaign. Once we have the technical know-how in place, Strong Body Whole Heart will be self-sustaining.

Please join us on our Facebook page for daily encouragement and inspiration as well as updates!

We truly believe that Strong Body Whole Heart will change lives, and we wholeheartedly thank you for believing in us and our mission through your support.

story:
imagine leaving the country, your job, your family, to explore a new terrain. Imagine once you reached your destination you had eleven u.s. dollars to your name. You arrive on the pacific coast of Mexico, after 36 hours on busses. you lose your glasses, only to arrive in the most beautiful place you've even been able (sorta) to see. Welcome to Mazunte.

 
I found a little yoga school up the hill from the towns claim to fame, the museo de tortuga.  Here I lived, worked, sweated and mostly smiled my way through six months of bliss. During a raw food workshop I was hosting, we conjured up Adaptozens, little herbal balls of bliss.
 
Fast forward. Year and three quarters. I somehow have ended up purchasing a mountain farm with my fiance and rekindled the passion for a healthy and vibrant community.
 
Our kitchen has turned into a culinary alchemical madhouse. Using our knowledge of all sects of herbal medicine, along with our culinary mad genius, we've come up with these primitive raw chocolates that satisfy the gourmand, the weekend warrior and the vegan purist. That's pretty freakin' difficult.
 
We combine local herbs with hand selected raw ingredients. Elaborating on the spectrum of human experience, we selected thus far to explore the themes of Bliss, vitality, wiseness and peace.  Extracting from these palettes are the tastes, textures, and herbal alchemy that we meld together in the form of chocolate.
 
 

For us, creating these adaptogenic, nutrient dense

raw chocolates has become an art form that weaves

through the five senses, and nourishes us as well.

 

 Our long term goal with this enterprise is to produce all the herbs, the maca, the chia & the raw honey on our homestead, with the profits being recycled back to our farm to create a herbal sanctuary. We desire to cultivate ancient medicinals and ethnobotanicals, solving barriers to growing exotic & tropical plants and trees, in order to create a totally harmonious, local & exotic mix of beneficial and rare species by creating habitats and microclimates on our land.  
 
We hope to see our micro enterprise positively impact our local economy, support wellness and sustainability, and create more demand for our local agricultural community to grow herbal medicine. Our target demographic is everyone. Children, our elders, punks and hipsters can all enjoy our chocolate. We are transparent. We're not interested in profit gained by draining another's. Our philosophy in business is the same in life. give back to our community, respect all life, and try to leave the world a little better than when we arrived. And I think we are on the right path.
 

So, onto the good stuff.

                 CHOCOLATE.

....raw

.......vegan

..........gluten-free

.............irrististably delicious

...............adaptogenic

.................herbal infused chocolates, mind you.


These aren't per-se, like anything you've ever experienced before. Up to fifty percent of these raw chocolates include adaptogenic herbs. These herbs have the amazing capability to give your body what it needs most.  In order for an herb to be classified as adaptogen, it must restore balance and strengthen the functioning of the body without throwing another organ or body system out of balance.

Adaptogens facilitate these changes by a wide range of actions rather than just by one specific action. Of equal importance to the herb’s active properties is its safety—an adaptogen must be nontoxic and non-habit forming, even when taken over a long period of time. 

             Adaptogens in our chocolates include

ashwaghanda, eleuthero, rhodiola, maca & gynostemma

Our body is a symphony of cells interacting in miraculous ways to produce each and every one of us. The foods we consume provide the fuel that allows the cells to grow and function On the simplest level we truly are what we eat - which brings us to.....

<<<>>><<<>>><<<>>><<<>>><<<>>><<<>>><<<>>><<<>>><<<>>

The main ingredient for our line of zenned out offerings is raw cacao. A truly amazing tree, Theobromus cacao is the only food that contains anandamide, the neurotransmitter responsible for the feeling of BLISS.  It also contains phenethylamine, the LOVE molecule, and a healthy dose of dopamine, that boosts motivation and pleasure.

We add a bit of locally produced raw honey and glow-encouraging raw coconut oil to make our base for the herbal chocolate confections. 

<<<<<<><><>>>>>>>>CHILL - a remarkably relaxing and brightening blend

<<<<<<><relaxes your muscles and gives support for restful sleep and stress relief.

<<<<<<><><>>>>>>>>BLISS - gives you a boost of euphoria and motivation.

<<<<<<><><>>>>>>>>BUZZ for endurance athletes and weekend warriors alike

<<<<<<><><>>>>>>>>SAGE - for cranial expansion <> so you can bust out that epic poem you memorized in grad school twenty years later.


           Now is the time to share them with the world.

There are so many other things going on at WildCraft Apothecary - our focus on this campaign is on bringing Adaptozen - Herbal Infused Raw Chocolates to local markets. If we receive more funding than our initial goal, our Herbal Lib(er)ations and Wild elixirs will be available that much sooner!  Now that wouldn't that be fun? We've concocted Zoom superfood bumps, Electric, an Herbal Electrolyte Elixir, Ambrosia, a superfood infused honey, Rawtella, an addictive vegan nutella, Illumination, a skinfood Herbal Lib(er)ation, and much more! Maca Macaroons, Raw Almond Butter Cups...We hope to roll these out as well but let's stay focused on what we need to get these treats to the people!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a few things to become a sustainable business and still keep our philosophies in check. We're applying this money to logging hours at our community commercial kitchen...which happens to be right down the road from our farm.  Quite a perk! There we will handcraft our delectable creations, all organic, all the time, of course.

We will also be using your contributions for applying for an LLC license & for crafting a wonderful website.

We need to procure quantities of sustainable packaging (glass and compostable vegetable plastics) All of the design work and labels have been created by Eva. Now we just need them printed.

We need to source quality sustainable ingredients in bulk for our first wholesale order.

We have some really neat swag to offer in exchange for some help with our campaign!  Check it out!

Contributors wanting their Adaptozens sent as gifts for Christmas please donate by Thanksgiving so we can assure a timely delivery!

Any contribution gets a 25% off coupon to use for a future purchase. Anyone who contributes 10$ or more gets in on some raw herbal confections! These are tasty treats, and excellent gifts for the holidays - for an overworked best friend, your local eccentric scholar, or even your flamingo loving neighbor.

YOUR IMPACT

Your support means the world to us.  The ability to have a fullfilling life nurturing the wildness in all of us is a goal I know we can achieve together.  We thank you, each and every one of you, for your contribution.
 
Live long and prosper!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you can't part with your hard-earned cash. We understand! If you like our idea but can't help financially, pretty pretty please like our campaign on Facebook, and help get the word out! Thanks in advance!

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone, Everyone has a “where was I during Sandy story”. We were all affected either directly or indirectly. My mom, Alice Fernandez, has been a social worker for her entire life. Since she was young she knew that helping the less fortunate was what she wanted to do with her life. It’s been my mom’s mission to ensure that the underserved and under privileged always have a voice. My mom has been that voice for so many, helping countless lives, throughout her career. My mom raised two sons, been a mentor and friend to others. My mother is a very proud person, never looking for help for herself, even when she really needed help, she always rolled up her sleeves, making a pot of rice and getting the job done. However, this is a time, that she is in need of assistance and I’m calling on my friends and those of you that know her for help. She would even not be happy about this message. On the night of the Storm, moms water heater was damaged and she is need of a new one. It’s going to cost about $2,000.00 to replace. Unfortunately, FEMA does not reimburse folks, they only offer a low interest loan. So those of you thinking about helping someone, my mom who has helped so many…can use some help herself. Inbox me if you’re interested in contributing, Thank you all very much for any assistance you can provide.

Thanks agian, Marc & Paul Fernandez (grateful sons)

story:
Help Us Stretch the Goal to $30,000 and See Expanding Results.

Our expanded goal is to assure the Maasai girls of Esiteti attend an Alternative Rite of Passage (ARP) and continue their education. ASK will underwrite the costs for three ARP ceremonies a year, up to 2017. Starting 2018, the Maasai women will have had the knowledge to conduct their own ARP program In conjunction with the ARP program, the necessary training to conduct their own ARP ceremonies, as well as expand the program to surrounding Maasai communities and throughout Kenya.  

Women are known to be the foundation for change. By teaching these women leadership, we are building their confidence to support the ARP program beyond the next 5 years and ensure that FGM is stopped. 

                                      

The Trip to Kenya that Changed My Life

I’m Teri Gabrielsen, founder and Executive Director of Africa Schools of Kenya (ASK). While traveling in Africa fifteen years ago, I met a Maasai Chief whose village of 1000 people overlooks Mt. Kilimanjaro in Maasailand, Kenya. My life took a dramatic turn that day as I listened to Chief Kamete share his dream of building a school - making education available to every boy and girl in his community, and witnessed Kamete teaching five students the alphabet under a large Acacia tree by writing the letters with a stick in the dirt. As a retired teacher with a career in Media, I knew I had the skills and passion to make Chief Kamete’s dream, and now mine, a reality! And together, we did...

Creating Hope Through Maasai Education for Girls

                                        

Today, Esiteti Primary School and the newly constructed Girls’ Boarding School are two of the most state-of-the-art buildings in Maasailand, and in one of the remote areas outside of Amboseli National Park. There are over 400 students and 9 certified teachers, and ASK has put numerous programs in place, such as a Student Scholarship Program and a women’s beading program that helps sustain the elementary school.

Obstacle to Education–Female Genital Mutilation

Ninety-three percent of Maasai girls go through a mandatory ritual of having their clitoris cut off at puberty, signifying their transition from childhood to adulthood. It also means they have to discontinue school and are married off, some as young as 11, 12 or 13 years old!  Ending the practice of female genital mutilation or cutting (FGM) allows young girls to stay in school and postpone marriage until they have finished at least high school. 

Not only are there emotional and physical consequences with FGM, there are serious health risks, such as shock, hemorrhage, HIV/AIDS, damage to the urethra resulting in urinary incontinence, infection and severe scar formation, dyspareunia (painful sexual intercourse), infertility, and death. There is a Kenyan law in place that prohibits FGM, but it is rarely enforced.

 A Change of Mindset - An Alternative Rite of Passage

                                       

With our guidance, the Esiteti community recently embraced the reality that educated girls are much more valuable to the community than uneducated ones. Last year, the elder men and women decided to abandon the age-old custom of female circumcision, which is deeply rooted in their culture. They asked us to help design a ‘coming of age’ ceremony that would confirm a girl’s transition to adulthood in the eyes of the community without the ritual of cutting.

In August of 2012, with the help of the Maasai, Africa Schools of Kenya designed the Alternative Rite of Passage (ARP) Program, and the first-ever 2-day ARP ceremony was conducted with 52 girls! Trained Maasai nurses and ARP educators discuss topics such as myths surrounding FGM, the health risks, as well as the laws and human rights issue. Rather than traditionally marrying off these girls at a young tender age, the graduates of an ARP Program are spared the physical and emotional consequences of FGM and have the opportunity to continue their education.

Changing Thousands of Girls' Lives Forever

                                          

With your donations, Africa Schools of Kenya is able to continue this important work with the ARP Program, impacting thousands of girls in the surrounding area of Maasailand, Kenya. Our goal is for the ARP Program to grow and eventually be used throughout Kenya as a new sustainable “coming of age” ceremony.

The money raised through this campaign will fund 15 Alternative Rite of Passage (ARP) ceremonies (50+ girls per ceremony) over the next 5 years.

By 2017, at least 750 girls from Esiteti will be uncircumcised, and over 200 women will be trained to conduct their own ARP program due to the Life-Skill and ARP Training Program. Neighboring villages have already asked how they can start an ARP program.

Other Ways To Help

Please "SHARE" our Alternative Rite of Passage program and the Workshops for the women on your social media networks. These Maasai girls and women are worthy of our attention! EDUCATION is their only hope. By donating or spreading the word, you will help change the course of hundreds of girls and women's lives forever!
story_txt:
Help Us Stretch the Goal to $30,000 and See Expanding Results.
Our expanded goal is to assure the Maasai girls of Esiteti attend an Alternative Rite of Passage (ARP) and continue their education. ASK will underwrite the costs for three ARP ceremonies a year, up to 2017. Starting 2018, the Maasai women will have had the knowledge to conduct their own ARP program In conjunction with the ARP program, the necessary training to conduct their own ARP ceremonies, as well as expand the program to surrounding Maasai communities and throughout Kenya.  
Women are known to be the foundation for change. By teaching these women leadership, we are building their confidence to support the ARP program beyond the next 5 years and ensure that FGM is stopped. 
                                       

The Trip to Kenya that Changed My Life

I’m Teri Gabrielsen, founder and Executive Director of Africa Schools of Kenya (ASK). While traveling in Africa fifteen years ago, I met a Maasai Chief whose village of 1000 people overlooks Mt. Kilimanjaro in Maasailand, Kenya. My life took a dramatic turn that day as I listened to Chief Kamete share his dream of building a school - making education available to every boy and girl in his community, and witnessed Kamete teaching five students the alphabet under a large Acacia tree by writing the letters with a stick in the dirt. As a retired teacher with a career in Media, I knew I had the skills and passion to make Chief Kamete’s dream, and now mine, a reality! And together, we did...
Creating Hope Through Maasai Education for Girls
                                         
Today, Esiteti Primary School and the newly constructed Girls’ Boarding School are two of the most state-of-the-art buildings in Maasailand, and in one of the remote areas outside of Amboseli National Park. There are over 400 students and 9 certified teachers, and ASK has put numerous programs in place, such as a Student Scholarship Program and a women’s beading program that helps sustain the elementary school.

Obstacle to Education–Female Genital Mutilation

Ninety-three percent of Maasai girls go through a mandatory ritual of having their clitoris cut off at puberty, signifying their transition from childhood to adulthood. It also means they have to discontinue school and are married off, some as young as 11, 12 or 13 years old!  Ending the practice of female genital mutilation or cutting (FGM) allows young girls to stay in school and postpone marriage until they have finished at least high school. 
Not only are there emotional and physical consequences with FGM, there are serious health risks, such as shock, hemorrhage, HIV/AIDS, damage to the urethra resulting in urinary incontinence, infection and severe scar formation, dyspareunia (painful sexual intercourse), infertility, and death. There is a Kenyan law in place that prohibits FGM, but it is rarely enforced.
 A Change of Mindset - An Alternative Rite of Passage

                                        
With our guidance, the Esiteti community recently embraced the reality that educated girls are much more valuable to the community than uneducated ones. Last year, the elder men and women decided to abandon the age-old custom of female circumcision, which is deeply rooted in their culture. They asked us to help design a ‘coming of age’ ceremony that would confirm a girl’s transition to adulthood in the eyes of the community without the ritual of cutting.
In August of 2012, with the help of the Maasai, Africa Schools of Kenya designed the Alternative Rite of Passage (ARP) Program, and the first-ever 2-day ARP ceremony was conducted with 52 girls! Trained Maasai nurses and ARP educators discuss topics such as myths surrounding FGM, the health risks, as well as the laws and human rights issue. Rather than traditionally marrying off these girls at a young tender age, the graduates of an ARP Program are spared the physical and emotional consequences of FGM and have the opportunity to continue their education.
Changing Thousands of Girls' Lives Forever
                                           
With your donations, Africa Schools of Kenya is able to continue this important work with the ARP Program, impacting thousands of girls in the surrounding area of Maasailand, Kenya. Our goal is for the ARP Program to grow and eventually be used throughout Kenya as a new sustainable “coming of age” ceremony.
The money raised through this campaign will fund 15 Alternative Rite of Passage (ARP) ceremonies (50+ girls per ceremony) over the next 5 years.
By 2017, at least 750 girls from Esiteti will be uncircumcised, and over 200 women will be trained to conduct their own ARP program due to the Life-Skill and ARP Training Program. Neighboring villages have already asked how they can start an ARP program.
Other Ways To Help
Please "SHARE" our Alternative Rite of Passage program and the Workshops for the women on your social media networks. These Maasai girls and women are worthy of our attention! EDUCATION is their only hope. By donating or spreading the word, you will help change the course of hundreds of girls and women's lives forever!

story:
Re-3 is a family owned start - up company I founded to develop nutrition based - pharmaceutically competitive nutritional products. We have been conducting R&D on an herbal tea that provides impressive, broad - based health benefits. Based upon scientific studies conducted on the Jiaogulan herb, we believe this tea may be one of the healthiest teas in the world. Re-3 has developed a branded line of Jiaogulan teas named Adaptix Multi - Health & Weight - Loss Teas. The benefits provided by Adaptix Multi - Health Teas, target four of the most serious chronic health conditions facing many Americans today: diabetes/pre-diabetes, hypertension, high cholesterol levels and weight/obesity issues. While Adaptix Multi - Health Teas are not a "cure all", these teas do provide broad - based health benefits that may help many people live healthier, happier and more productive lives. Re-3's goal is twofold. Improve people's lives by improving their health - making Adaptix Multi - Health Teas available to everyone and creating new jobs and opportunities for Americans by growing Jiaogulan tea in the US - not importing the tea as we presently do. You can help us accomplish these goals by donating funds to make this happen. Please share this campaign with family, friends, and co - workers. Thank you for your support and drink Adaptix Multi - Health Teas today and feel the difference!

The name of the herb/tea is Jiaogulan - botanically known as Gynostemma pentaphyllum. In South Central China where Jiaogulan was initially discovered, Jiaogulan is known as "ziancao" which translated means "Immortality". The people of Guizhou province gave this name to Jiaogulan tea due to the broad - based health benefits provided by drinking Jiaogulan tea - which included living longer, healthier lives. More than 300 scientific studies have been conducted validating the impressive health benefits of Jiaogulan. Today, Jiaogulan tea is also grown in Southeast Asia. Re-3 sources our organic Jiaogulan tea from Southeast Asia.   

Potential health benefits provided by Jiaogulan tea:

  • Reduction in insulin resistance, blood glucose and A1c
  • Reduction in high blood pressure
  • Reduction in LDL-C and Triglycerides
  • Potential weight - loss (we have seen individuals lose 20 pounds in 90 days)
  • Increase in Superoxide dismutase (SOD) the body's most powerful endogenous antioxidant - thought to be 3500% stronger as an antioxidant than vitamin C
  • Increase in white blood cell count (WBC) which benefits the immune system
  • Increase in energy and endurance
  • Reduction in stress

We have developed a blended Organic/Kosher certified Jiaogulan tea product - Adaptix Multi - Health & Weight - Loss Teas. Adaptix Multi - Health & Weight - Loss Teas are available in Regular and Peach flavors with Apple - Cinnamon,Mango and Pomegranate flavors to be added. Recently formulated Adaptix Multi - Health Anti - Aging Tea, is a proprietary blend of Jiaogulan tea and Reishi mushroom. Reishi mushroom is known as the "Mushroom of Immortality" and the "King of Herbs" in Traditional Chinese Medicine. Cardiovascular disease (CVD) and cancer are the #1 and #2 killers of US adults (CDC 2011). Jiaogulan tea can positively benefit CVD related health conditions while Reishi mushroom provides powerful chemo - preventitive (cancer prevention) benefits. Both Jiaogulan tea and Reishi mushroom provide additional synergistic health benefits. Adaptix Multi - Health Teas are naturally caffeine - free, taste great hot or iced and can be enjoyed by everyone.

Re-3 has completed the Adaptix Multi - Health Teas packaging and the adaptixtea.com web site (we need to add our Anti-Aging tea) - thanks to the help of family members and friends. We have lined up our direct marketing partners who include: Everyday Health (the #1 internet health web site), RealAge (Dr. Oz/Dr. Roizen's web site), Prevention Magazine, AARP, LifeScript.com, etc. Re-3 has also developed Q- ardio (pronounced cardio), a healthy sports nutrition supplement successfully used by Coach Peter Smith (the Head Tennis Coach at USC) and his athletes. Donors will have the opportunity to purchase Q - ardio at preferred donor pricing once we launch Q-ardio.

Re-3 needs donations to fund the initial production and marketing of Adaptix Multi - Health Teas and to set - up our warehouse. Our goal is to raise $25,000 in 25 days.

There are 105 million US adults that are diabetic or pre/diabetic, 74 million with hypertension or pre-hypertension, 104 million have high cholesterol and 60% of Americans are either overweight or obese. As donors to our campaign, you have the opportunity to help us positively impact millions of people's lives by improving their health. Please share this campaign with family, friends and co - workers. We appreciate everyone's help and look forward to bringing you Adaptix Multi - Health Teas - the healthiest teas in the world!

story:
Starting Monday Auguest 13th, I will be the new head chef at Rum Runnerz Bar and Grille in Dunmore, Pennsylvania. I have created a menu that will be all fresh, local ingredients and everything will be homemade. All items from the porketta, to the pierogies, to handformed burgers, right down to the french fries will be made fresh.

I am a Dunmore local with a culinary arts degree from the Culinary Institute of America. I have cooked up and down the east coast from Atlanta, Georgia to Block Island. I have worked for big time companies like the Mariott to smaller, locally owned resaturants. I will be using the knowledge and experience from these jobs to help provide Rum Runnerz with a bar menu that is affordable to everybody. I will also be featuring a Daily Dinner that will be sure to provide a complete meal for all you people looking for an inexpensive meal after work. Things like fish and chips, ribs, and turkey dinners (with real roasted turkey, not just sliced turkey breast) will change daily.

I am looking to gather funds to make some small equipment purchases. A deep fryer, a refrigeration unit, and some smallwares. My menu does not consist of all deep fried frozen food, but a good deep fryer is invaluable in a kitchen. But in order to produce good quality food, first I need to buy and prepare good quality food. But even the best food will go bad quickly without proper refrigeration. I am trying to keep my frozen food to a minimal (just about non existant really), but in order to do that I need to have some place to store my cold items. I will be food shopping and prepping daily so I won't need a lot of refrigeration space, but I will need more than what I have right now. And I need to buy some plastic Cambro containers and other items of the like to help keep all the food safe and sanitary in the kitchen.

Even if you can't help out financially, there are other ways to help. Maybe you have some pots and pans you don't use anymore. Or maybe you know a place where I can get a good deal. Any help is a big help.

story:
In Feb 2011, my husband went to the Hospital with what he presumed was a dizzy spell.

He failed the hand to nose test and was sent to a second hospital which performed a ct scan. The ct scan showed that he had a stroke and needed further Testing at yet a third hospital located an hour away from our home.  At about 10 pm that same evening I arrived at the hospital to find a very confused staff in the stroke ward where my husband was located.  

  I can remember getting upset as the nurses came into his Room with a booklet of information on how to learn the signs of a stroke. I felt like my cooking was killing him and felt completely responsible for it.  But My husbands cholesterol, blood pressure and heart were all healthy after testing over twenty vials of blood. It was then decided that he get further testing as the stroke made no sence at the time to anyone including myself.  He got an MRI and a few hours later a mass was found in his brain. It was then determined it was not a stroke but seizures. Strokes and seizures all show up the same on ct scans, but are different on MRIs as they are more detailed. 

We were very scared. Doctors could not provide much information to us until it was Biopsied.

A few days spent in the hospital, a biopsy to determine its grade and it felt like our world was coming down. We were beyond scared. A family to raise Bills to pay and we were already living paycheck to paycheck just like everyone else we knew. We got help from my mom who did a lot to help us keep a roof over our heads. My husband was unable to work and his job offered no disability at that time. What could we do? He got the biopsy and was released two days later to rest at home.

  A few weeks later the results came back inconclusive, so a few weeks later we made an  appointment at the cancer center in Baltimore, Maryland to get a second opinion of his tumor.  We came back home with the same results and were still feeling pretty overwhelmed.  It was then determined to be a grade two glioma lower frontal temporal lobe brain tumor. Talked big words! 

On top of it all, His medication needed to be adjusted several times before returning to work on a trial basis.  That late June he returned to work only to miss a week of work almost every month because of pill adjustments. We learned there are approximately 28 different seizure preventative pills on the market and the trick was to find which combo worked best for him.

  In October we were referred to a neurologist who worked closely with him to find the perfect dose and combo of medication.  A few months later with bills and medication costs still piling up, he began to have seizures yet again! 

  It was eventually suggested by his neurologist and neurosurgeon that he have as much of the tumor (that was also wrapped around his main artery) removed that was safe For him. After a few weeks of thought, my husband agreed.  I can be honest in saying i was so afraid of losing him, it took lots of convincing me to support his decision. Selfish? Yes. But more terrified than anything else. After a six and a half hour surgery, March 2012, about 75% was removed successfully.   We still dont have exact amounts because the brain is still swollen but he will always have tumor in him as they were unable to remove it all without damaging or paralyzing him. We do know It went from about the size of a large egg to about the size of a half dollar.

My husband has been out of work since his operation and is unable to return at this time.  We've been turned down for financial help, on just about every other door we've tried to open. Something needs to be done!

 

  He was fortunate that the company he works for finally got disability insurance (because of him) so we were able to qualify for short term for 13 weeks. It has run out as of june 21st and we were turned down for Long Term due to it being an apparent "pre existing" condition.

 

That's been a fight too. We keep arguing with them that he just needs more time to heal.

Most of our monthly bills cannot be paid. Noone will help, but we've been active on keeping on top of things, and some bill collectors have been sympathetic for our situation, they still want to set up a payment date.  It has been a rough and frightening road traveled.

After all that he's already been through- We have then learned that Behind the tumor is also a spot of cancer. He will need 6 months of chemotherapy treatments, perhaps more we cannot cross that bridge until we get to it.

  After 32 treatments of chemo and radiation, traveling over an hour every day for treatments with weekends off,  he is now recuperating, and they are keeping a close eye on the tumor with an MRI every three months.  The radiation lasts in the body long after treatments are over, and he is constantly fatigued, and has short term memory damage, tremors, and is very impulsive and more... He has become a different person. Who wouldn't though. His body has been through a lot, it will take time to heal.

I am worried sick. Losing it all (mortgage and basic utilities) scares me less than losing him.

Through this rough road we have learned a valuable lesson to learn to take life day by day. But it is often hard to focus on that lesson until we are reminded that life could get much worse. We will always have each other and our gorgeous three year old son gets us through each and every single day. Life is precious.  

  The funds received will help to alleviate the two hundred dollar a month medication burden as well as getting caught up on past due bills incurred throughout this entire ordeal.  

Words of wisdom and encouragement , positive vibes, all is welcomed and appreciated. Grey Matters is the theme for brain cancer awareness  it is the color of brain cancer awareness ribbons.

Additionally I would like to thank the following people- my mom and best friend, (Mary Ann) for everything you have done for us and still do every single day. We love you so much!  My mother in law (Denise) for having such a positive outlook through it all. I will never understand how you were able to hold it all together as I was falling apart. Lots of love and respect to you.  My sister in law aka Fuffy for holding my hand and your emotional support. You are Such a strong young lady! PS: Brownie points?  My father for keeping tabs on us and helping when you could. We love you! My cousin and her husband for the initial ride  to the hospital and for listening to all my frustrations. My husbands bff sean for helping to motivate my husband when i all but gave up. All our friends and family who visited him at the hospital.  I didnt get to meet all of you, but I'm so happy that you came to see him. It meant a lot to him.  My anti girls who have heard it all. Lots of love for my girls. Miss. G for your upbeat attitude and bringing our spirits up to a whole new level.

  My family and friends for prayers and good vibes.  All the Drs, Nurses and staff of st. Lukes- And even the concierge and valet parkers that helped get my husbands positive vibes way up! I cannot thank you all enough!

 And of course a huge Thank you alll so much for reading this.  And please pass on if you can!

- written and updated by Dawn Shumack (could not figure out how to edit that section.)

story:
Short Summary

Most of us take our good health for granted.  However, more than 50 million of us don't have health insurance and thus don't take advantage of basic, preventative healthcare services.

50 million.  That's a problem.  Be part of the solution.  As Ghandi said "Be the change you wish to see in the world."  That's what I'm doing.

I'm Chris Pantuso, Founder & Executive Director of The Calabria Foundation.  Learn more about me by clicking here.  Learn more about the Foundation and our plans to roll out a fleet of mobile medical units by clicking here.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,700 during this initial round.  Any money received will be directed towards (in order of priority):

  • Website Development
  • New Computer Equipment
  • Satellite Internet Service
  • Marketing Brochures
  • Medical Testing Supplies
  • Staff training

What do you get for joining forces with us?  In addition to the knowledge and good feelings you'll receive for helping out such a worthy cause, you will also:

  1. $20 donation - "Thank You" email from the Founder
  2. $50 donation - above + "Thank You" book from the Founder
  3. $100 donation - above + Signed Certificate from the Foundation
  4. $500 donation - above + (2) free tix to Annual Fund Raising Bash
  5. $1,000 donation - above + Naming Rights to a Mobile Medical Unit

The Impact

The donations made to the Foundation during this initial round of fundraising will help to "prime the pump" for the funding requests we've made to Federal, State and Local Governments as well as Private Foundations. The ripples created by a pebble tossed into a lake will grow into something much greater given enough force and energy.

Ready to make some waves?

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize you may not be able to donate any money to this cause.  However, I'd love to talk with you about donating your time and/or talent.  Reach out to me via skype (chris.pantuso) and let's put our heads together.  Or, if you've read this far, please share this with your friends!

Peace,

Chris

story:
Short Summary

Aloha,

My name is Ikelene. This campaign was put together by friends and fellow volunteers. I am humbled by this whole experience. I have dedicated my whole life to fundraising, charity work, and end of life services. I never dreamed of a day when there would be such an outpouring of support for my needs. A lifetime of undiagnosed systemic lupus has meant years of medications that masked the symptoms and damaged my body. I even had my large intestine removed. I jokingly call myself "Gutless Wonder". Nothing short of a miracle resulted in my diagnosis just a few months ago. Unfortunately I am losing my hearing and one of the medications I am on could cause vision loss in as little as six months. My kidneys and liver are also under attack. I decided to seek alternative treatment. An Oasis of Healing has been the only alternative treatment center to accept my request. They believe I can be healed in approximately four weeks. Treatment is expensive, but highly effective. I just want to get back to giving back. Any contribution will go to helping more than one woman get well. It will help me help others.

What We Need & What You Get

An Oasis of Healing estimates I will benefit from 4 weeks of treatment:

Treatments:

Complete blood work / Hormone panel / Unine Toxic Metals testing / Intravenous Therapeutic Vitamin C / Chelation (EDTA) / Ultraviolet Blood Irridation (UBI) / Autohemotherapy / Ozone and Hydrogen Peroxide / Supervised Juice Feast / Lymphatic Massage / Acupuncture / Yoga / Reflection Meditation

Treatment can range from $2,800 - $4,500 per week

Lodging (depending on how soon our goal is reached and availability ) $1,500- $2,500 for a month

Car Rental $850- $1,000 for a month

Round Trip Air Fair for two (a companion is recommended) approximately $1,000

Estimated living expenses approximately $1,000.

This is a total of only $22,500 in the most expensive scenario, but all donations not used to heal me will go towards healing others. I truly hope to exceed this goal, so that we can make a difference in the lives of others who need treatment and support. This is not just about me.

The Impact

This is a section that has limitless potential if we all come together. The donations are about getting me well so I can get on about helping others. This is about shedding light on alternatives to surgeries, and prescription drugs. It's community at its finest. We all deserve to be supported and sometimes that just means giving someone a voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to donate please give this campaign a voice. There is inspiration in this message. Let's spread the word.

Please use the indiegogo share tools too.

Mahalo Nui loa!

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Gacia Hajinian. I am a Canadian-born and raised teenager. I just graduated from high school with honours and as an Ontario Scholar. I am appealing to you to help me raise funds for my mother’s life-saving spine surgery. My 52-year-old mother, Sevan Hajinian, is one of the most dedicated people in our community. For more than 25 years she was a volunteer in the Canadian Civil Society, helping people who are in need, regardless of their religion, colour or race. She was a youth leader, school board trustee, a member of the parents and teachers committee, and church auxiliary committee. She also volunteered in social services, immigration, and as a government relations adviser. She also raised funds for a variety of worthwhile and charitable causes. My mother has always been a hard-working woman with high moral ethics. She instilled in my sister and I the same values and encouraged us to follow her example. 

My mother is suffering from a debilitating spinal illness which has had a devastating impact on her life and curtailed her church, community, social, and family life. 

 

My Mother's Story

In the last four years my mother has seen five Ontario spine surgeons, two neurologists, and one neurosurgeon. Two Canadian spine surgeons have refused to see her. The only recommendation for treatment they have suggested was the traditional morphine-based medication. One Toronto spine doctor told her “when you are in wheelchair come and see me and we will do something.” 

The Health Services Appeal and Review Board Panel (Ontario government health care insurance), which consisted of three people, all with a financial background and none with a medical background, released a decision not to fund her surgery in New York. This is a travesty of justice. My mother was denied natural justice and procedural fairness. The Board ignored critical testimony and facts which are crucial to rendering a fair and just decision.

Award-winning journalist Roy Green, on his blog, summed up the urgency of the issue as follows: "Sevan Hajinian of Toronto is in need of specialized back surgery. No Ontario surgeon she has spoken will agree to do the procedure because they say it's too complicated. Ms. Hajinian has found a surgeon in New York who has the expertise, but Ontario's health insurance plan will not pay for the $200,000 procedure." 



The Impact 

If my mother is not operated by the spine surgery specialist she will become paralyzed, have kidney and liver failure (because of morphine-based drugs) and has a high chance of becoming victim of MS due to lack of blood circulation to her brain. She takes eight Percocets a day to control her pain. Due to the stress of my mother’s illness, my father suffered a stroke.

A few months ago my family and friends launched a fundraising campaign, with the help of the Bishop of the Canadian-Armenian Church. In the last three months many people demonstrated their sympathy and solidarity through generous contributions. Different faith-based and civil society organizations participated and continue to raise funds. I am grateful to all of them. 

But my mother needs further assistance: we have not been able to raise the amount of money to cover her surgery expenses. We need to double our fundraising efforts. Therefore, I have set up this campaign to reach out to a much larger group of compassionate individuals and organizations.  

Hopefully, with your help my family and I will be able to see the light at the end of the tunnel. With your generous contributions you will be helping us end my mother’s and my family's nightmare - an agony we have lived with for the last four years. 
  
Your compassion, understanding and support are greatly appreciated by everyone in my family. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please circulate this appeal to your family, acquaintances, and any faith-based and civil society organizations which may be interested and involved in such humanitarian efforts. 

For additional information visit the following sites:

To watch the Michael Coren interview with my mother, please visit the below link: 

Sevan Hajinian Fighting For Her Life
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NF4UEj0ITQ8

 

To Listen to the Roy Green Interview, please click on the link below: http://www.humanrights4u.com/RoyGreenRadio

My mother’s Facebook page is:
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Sevan-Hajinian-Medical-Emergency/208349665951690 

 

For additional information and other media coverage, please visit:
http://www.humanrights4u.com/sign

 

To reach us or for additional information, please e-mail me at: ardash.amroyan@hotmail.com

 

“Time is of the essence.”

Award Winning Journalist Roy Green

story:
Dear community members of indiegogo, thank you for taking the time to visit this page.

Campaign

I arrange this campaign in order to raise money for a russian girl whose name is Kate Guseva. Doctors diagnosed her with a disease that diractly affects locomotive functions of her legs. Now she is incapable of walking without the help of her nearest and dearest. 

Funding

The target sum of money that will cover medical costs is 40,000 $. 50% of this amount is assumed by the charity foundation "Little Heroes" (http://www.littleheroesfoundation.com.au/), 25% are agreed to be paid by the fund of the Ministry of Health of Russian Federation. The left 10K $ need to be raised as soon as possible. Apart from medical costs the stipulated sum of money comprises the cost of aeroplane ticket for Kate and her mother and living costs in Germany, where the surgery will be carried out. 

Perks

Dear contributors, the only perk I can offer you is the photo of recovered Kate taking a promenade with her mother. Moreover, please follow the updates I will add regularly.

Conclusion

Kate will undergo surgery on the 16th of April 2013. All Kate's friends are striving to help funding the medical costs of the oncoming surgery but their efforts are not enough. I have seen numerous fabulous campaigns that significantly changed people's lives to the better. This is why I on behalf of those who are not indifferent to Kate's fate address this matter to the generous community of the Indiegogo. 

Please, help Kate to walk again.

 

P.S. I want to clarify last but not the least aspect of the campaign. Kate asked me not to upload any pictures of her or spread her personal details due to the nature of her disease. I appreciate her will. However, if you find necessary to tell her anything or feel the need to ask anything please contact me via email ao.alexeev@gmail.com or skype: februaryvictoria. I will immediately respond. Thank you.

story:
LET THE HEALING BEGIN!


  • My name is Misia Denéa , I am a 500- Hour Certified Yoga Instructor, Holistic Wellness Consultant. I founded HATHA HOLISTIC INTEGRATIVE WELLNESS in 2010 after I graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition.
  • I am raising $5,000 to edit/publish my NEW BOOK ( to be released in 2014), " FULL MOON & FULL FIGURED: Enjoying Yoga While Sumptuously Shapely" . I am also launching a unique Yoga Teacher Training Program (launching late 2014) for Low-Income  Individuals who are  Survivors of Sexual Violence and those who have developed Disordered Eating Habits as a Result of Sexual Violence.
  • This is Revolutionary! Nothing like this has been done before, Yoga is an ancient life-affirming healing practice that helps folks remove shame and guilt that fester in the body after experiencing sexual assault. THANK YOU IN ADVANCE for YOUR GENEROSITY & CONTRIBUTIONS!


WHY YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS IMPORTANT

The Deets:

  • I am raising $5,000 to cover the costs of: editing, publishing and distributing my NEW BOOK " FULL MOON & FULL FIGURED: Enjoying Yoga While Sumptuously Shapely" and also covering the costs of Launching my unique HATHA HOLISTIC INTEGRATIVE WELLNESS Yoga Teacher Training Program geared toward creating leaders in the Yoga & Wellness community who are Survivors of Sexual Violence and have Developed Disordered Eating Habits as a Result of Sexual Violence, the funds raised from this campaign will cover the costs of producing the manuals, DVD's and online education for those participating in the training.
  • I am offering GENEROUS GIFTS to those who are contributing to this campaign for me to raise $5,000
  • If I don't reach my goal ... Well , THAT AIN'T gonna happen.. I will create a PHASE 2  campaign, but I am confident that I will reach my goal!

HOW YOUR SUPPORT WILL MAKE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT in the WORLD OF HEALING ARTS & WELLNESS


  • Size Diversity is not easy to access in the Yoga World and Sexual Violence can leave deep emotional, mental and spiritual wounds for those who have survived it .Yoga has helped me with my journey to wholeness and healing and I want to share this experience with folks so they STEP INTO THEIR PERSONAL POWER and remove any lingering , festering fear, guilt or shame  that reside in the Body and show up in the form of emotional eating, overeating, binge eating or anorexia.
  • Since 2008 , My yoga classes and workshops have been packed with women ( and men) who have been relieved to have me as an instructor that help them move into a BODY POSITIVE expereince during yoga and holistic health consultations. Now is the time for me to help others become leaders in their community to help  FIGHT BODY SHAME with the help of Yoga & Holistic Wellness.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • MAKE SOME NOISE!- forward this information about my campaign widely to your networks! THANK YOU SO MUCH ! Every little bit counts!

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
The inaugural Run VK Pittsburgh (5K Race) is being held March 30, 2014 to benefit The V Foundation for Cancer Research.  This campaign is set up for those that wish to help that aren't able to participate in the event but still want to help in someway.

Our ultimate goal is to raise enough money to offset the costs of putting on this race so that all registration dollars will go to The Foundation where 100% of every dollar goes directly to fund cancer research of all types.

"Don't Give Up...Don't Ever Give Up!' is the motto and the words spoken by Jim Valvano (Jimmy V) in his infamous speech at the 1993 ESPY awards announcing the formation of The Foundation in partnership with ESPN.  

By supporting this campaign you will help fund this important event that not only supports cancer research but encourages participants to exercise and gain valuable knowledge about cancer prevention.

In return you may make a small donation or choose perks including a race t-shirt and a "Don't Give Up...Don't Every Give Up!" wristband shipped to you!

V Foundation Facts

The V Foundation for Cancer Research was founded in 1993 by ESPN and the late Jim Valvano, legendary NC State basketball coach and ESPN commentator.

The V Foundation awards 100 percent of direct cash donations and pledges directly to cancer research.

The Foundation awards grants through a competitive awards process strictly supervised by a Scientific Advisory Committee comprised of some of the nation’s top doctors and scientists.

The V Foundation has awarded more than $115 million, used to fund 540 cancer research grants nationwide.

The Foundation has awarded grants to more than 120 institutions in 38 states and the District of Columbia.

The race is being presented locally by the Pittsburgh & Duquesne Chapters of Delta Chi.

Since 2006 the brothers of Delta Chi Fraternity, Inc. have dedicated countless hours to their partnership with The V Foundation for Cancer Research.  With over 70 chapters involved in fundraising, Delta Chi has raised nearly $500,000 for the Foundation and generously donated three grants.  Delta Chi Fraternity’s core values are friendship, character, justice, and education – each of which have been exemplified in the brothers’ support of The V Foundation.
