story:
Volleyball i Morud            Idrætsforening

Hjælp os til fortsat at kunne spille volleyball i Morud

(For English summary please see below)

Interessen for volleyball er de sidste par år dalet på landsplan, og det kan vi også mærke hos os. Desværre hænger volleyball i en tynd tråd i Morud - med mindre vi får din hjælp. 

Vi har brug for nye spillere til vores hold og skal have rejst penge til hallejen, hvis ikke sæsonen skal blive den sidste. Derfor går vi nu nye veje og forsøger os med denne fundraiser.

Du kan, via siden her, hjælpe os på flere forskellige måder:

1. du kan melde dig til holdet næste sæson  2. du kan støtte holdet med et beløb efter eget valg  3. du kan vælge at blive sponsor for holdet. Alle tre valgmuligheder vil hjælpe os med at holde holdet kørende en sæson mere.

Morud volley er en del af Morud Idrætsforening, en aktiv forening med talrige tilbud og aktiviteter.

Vi kan tilbyde dig et hyggeligt volleyhold for både damer og herrer i alle aldre og på alle niveauer. Der er både gamle spillere, gamle rutinerede spillere, yngre spillere med en ulidelig kondition og helt grønne begyndere.

                         

Vi træner tirsdag aften 20:30 - 22:00 i Langesøhallen, Morud - alle er velkomne.

Der er plads til både tekniske øvelser og en masse spil over nettet, så om du kommer for at blive bedre til spillet eller for motionens skyld er der noget at hente.

                          

Vi har tidligere spillet turneringer og bliver vi nok spillere næste sæson er forhåbningerne at vi skal det igen. Det er turneringer hvor der er lagt vægt på bredde og motion, men samtidig er der tale om meget jævnbyrdige hold, så det er som regel både sjove og intense kampe - og vi plejer ikke at være dårligst.

Vi har også to Beach baner, der frit kan benyttes om sommeren.

Morud Volley er sponsoreret af

                         


   og konsulentfirmaet      BOTJEK a/s    www.botjek.dk


Hvordan hjælper jeg så?

Du hjælper ved at vælge en af de "perks" der er listet ude til højre.

1. Du kan melde dig til holdet ved at vælge kontigent "perken". Det koster ca. 750 kr. for sæsonen (alt efter dagskursen på € ). Det er selvfølgelig den løsning vi helst vil have du vælger - så vi kan få dig på holdet.

2. Du kan vælge at støtte holdet med et goodwill beløb ved at vælge en af de andre perks.

3. Du kan vælge at blive sponsor for holdet - ved at vælge sponsor "perken". Du støtter holdet med ca. 2250 kr. og vi finder en måde at eksponerer dit firma på i forbindelse med træning og evt. kampe. Kontakt kampagne manageren for yderligere info.

Hvordan fungerer den her fundraiser? 

Jo - det fungerer efter metoden fixed funding. Dvs. når man donerer/betaler kontigent lægges beløbet hos Indiegogo/paypal, og først når vi når slutdatoen for fundingen og hvis målet (de € 500) er nået, sendes pengene videre til klubben. Det betyder også, at når vi ikke målet, får alle deres penge retur og ingen taber således penge på at støtte et projekt der ikke ikke kommer op at stå.


Stretch Goal 1. € 1300

Vores træner vil gerne fortsætte næste sæson, så vore første stretch goal er € 1300, der vil give os nok til beholde ham også.


English summary 

Unfortunately a decline in members in our small volley club have led to us closing this summer - unless get some new players and raise money to pay the rent for the sports hall. Once we get some new members and get to keep playing the second goal in to raise money enough to keep our coach.

The team is a social team, playing for the exercise and the love of the game, though we usually participate in several smaller tournaments a year.

So anyone, we need your help - whether you support us with a small amount, become a regular sponsor or buy in on a full year of volleyball, your help will be greatly appreciated.

story:
My name is Johnny "The Motivator" Carrero. I've been Personal Training since 1989, competed in 3 Powerlifting meets and 8 Bodybuilding events. I have Promoted the Natural Mr/Ms California for over 20 years.

Mission Statement

My Own Personal Trainer  is the go to video encyclopedia for all trainers, gym members, and fitness enthusiasts worldwide. Teaching the safest and most efficient way to exercise using proper form and  technique. It would be awesome to walk into any Gym in the world and see everyone doing exercises correctly and safely!

My Own Personal Trainer

Just imagine, My Own Personal Trainer in the palm of my hand available 24/7, 365 days per year. This will allow you to bring My Own Personal Trainer with you whether you are Traveling for work, on Vacation, or just at the gym. It is a Video Encyclopedia of each individual exercise explained in detail. 

It will consist of:

  • Proper Form
  • Technique
  • Grip Position
  • Where to apply the pressure while lifting
  • and much more.

The Safest, Most Efficient way to exercise!

Stated by the Mayo Clinic:

"Effective weight training depends on proper technique." 

"You don't have to be a bodybuilder or professional  athlete to reap the benefits of weight training." "When done correctly, weight training can help you lose fat, increase your strength and muscle tone, and improve your bone density." "If done incorrectly, however, weight training won't give you these benefits — and may even lead to injury."

Check your technique

"You might learn weight training techniques by watching friends or others in the gym — but sometimes what you see isn't safe." "Incorrect weight training technique can lead to sprains, strains, fractures and other painful injuries that may hamper your weight training efforts."

http://www.mayoclinic.org/weight-training/art-20045842

How it Works

When you become a monthly subscriber you will then log in and have access to the video encyclopedia. If you are looking for a chest exercise, you will click on the chest of the anatomy chart and all the chest exercise videos will appear.Choose the one you want to learn. Watch it, learn it, then apply it! Every body part will have many exercises from which you can choose.

 

Once a week I will post a new video. The first week of the month will be a "Workout Video."  For example: My favorite Back and Shoulder workout. I will go over the exercises, what order to put them in, the repetitions and sets needed and why.

Week two will be "My Recipes." I will show you step by step how to prepare some healthy delicious meals for the week.

Week three, I will go over "Stretches" for a particular body part and explain the importance and reason for stretching.

Week four will be a "Q&A with The Motivator." I will choose one or more questions from subscribers and answer them in complete detail. 

All of this at your finger tips anywhere, anytime for only $9.99 per month.


How will your contributions be spent?

$6,000 on two HD Video cameras  with high powered microphones for different angles, excellent quality and clarity.

$2000 on video lighting and tri-pods

$2000 on editing program and web design 


Thanks to all of you that took time out of your day to take a look at my project! I feel with all your help we can Prevent Injuries, Protect Joints, and help everyone be more Efficient in the workout program they are on. Thank You for helping me get the "Focus back into Fitness!"

story:
My name is Joey.

I am a registered nurse from Tennessee and back in February of this year I realized that I had a problem with alcohol. I was not in trouble with work or law enforcement, I have never gone to work impaired or hungover, I wanted to get help before any thing like that happened and I hurt someone else or myself. I went in search for help out of the knowledge that I had a problem that I had tried to solve myself but failed to do so.  

I sought out help through my employer and went inpatient to detox. After 3 days my doctor told me that I was to be discharged and that I need to set up some out patient treatment and one on one counseling as well. I would be able to return to work in a week.

When I went for my first counseling session, which I was doing through my employer, I was asked a lot of questions. One question was whether or not I had had any law enforcement issues due to alcohol. I told them that I had had a DUI last year and that my employer knew about this before hiring me. Well, the EAP office, which I was getting counseling through, said they did not know about it and even though it was on my application, resume, and work record and even though my managers and human resources knew about it I shouldn’t have been hired without an assessment.

I was sent to a treatment facility and told I would have a week long assessment and then would have to follow what ever plan of treatment was recommended for me. I was told not to worry and the most it would be was a month.

My recommendations were 12 weeks of rehab followed by 6 months of sober living. During this time I would no be allowed to work as an RN and if I did not complete this treatment plan the board of nursing would be informed and my license revoked or suspended.

The total cost of this treatment is going to be around $50,000. I have already paid through help of family and friends $30,000. I am at my wits end and have no other resources available to me. I have completed the 12 weeks of rehab with no problems. I am very grateful for the treatment I have gotten and I have no desire to drink or cravings or ill effects ongoing. But I do have a huge debt to pay and I cannot complete my sober living without $20,000.

So I am asking for help. I know a lot of people will say that I put myself in this position by drinking, and yes, I did do just that. But I was cleared to return to work before I was told to get this treatment and I had been sober for 2 weeks. Also, one of the things I learned in treatment was that as an alcoholic I have to learn to ask for help. I have to learn to turn to others when I am unable to do for myself. This not asking for help is one thing that will lead a person right back to drink.

So here I am. Asking humbly for assistance so that I may return to the career I love and more importantly get all the help I can to continue the sobriety that I have enjoyed for the last three months and hope to continue for the rest of my life.

Thank you. A heartfelt thank you. It's all I can offer at the moment. After I get back to work and on my feet financially I will start repaying everyone who contributes. It will take time but it will be done.  

Thanks. 

Joey M.

story:
Who I am & My Project Idea

Hi there!

I am a 21 year old Photography student studying at University Of South Wales, photography has been a passion of mine for over 5 years now starting out on a 2 year National Diploma at CCAD before moving on to study Photography For Fashion & Advertising at University. 

I enjoy many forms of photography such as fashion, documentary & surrealism. I feel that my main strength is when I am being experimental with different elements such as lighting, shadows, silhouettes, projections and reflections to name just a few. 

Which leads me on to my latest project Psychedelic Projection! My idea for this project is to use nude/semi nude models to create a series of images in which I would like to use a projector to project different images/textures onto the skin, using the body like a canvas for the projection. Although I am using nudity to create my final images I'd like the outcome to be fairly subtle in the way its executed, taking inspiration from the likes of Martha Madigan & Ryan McGinley. My theme for the projections is going to be Psychedelia so there will be a strong use of vivid colours and abstract shape. 

We do not receive funding from University to help towards our projects so your contribution is vital to help make my idea become a reality! 


Where Your Money Is Going

Breakdown Of Costs:


Models: £300

Hiring of projector: £30

New 50mm lens for the project: £70

Food for the models: £30

Cost of final printing: £40

Cost of photography portfolio box: £30


Great casting is essential, if I do not reach my goal of £500 your funding will still help towards booking some fantastic models and taking me one step further towards the project I would love to create. 

If you are unable to contribute you can still help by getting the word out about my project on Facebook, Twitter and other social networking sites. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Please feel free to visit my website, www.ameliamayphotography.com or find me on Facebook at www.facebook.com/AmeliaMayPhotography to see more of my portfolio or email me directly at ameliamayphoto@hotmail.com

story: I am opening a bakery called Katie Cakes n Bakes. "Katie" comes from my childhood family nickname given to me by my grandfather. I've been baking since I was 8 yrs old, and the desire to share my passion and love for all things delicious through my home baked goods has never left me. I'm finally listening to the little voice inside of me and pursuing my long-time passion of starting a bakery. I don't want another year to go by and think, "I should've..." So I'm stepping out of my comfort zone and swallowing my fears. There's been a cupcake craze that has left a gap in the Las Vegas bakery market and I intend to fill that with home-baked goods like high quality brownies, banana breads, muffins and of course, moist n delicious cakes. All of which made with creamy butter and most importantly, love. I plan to use the money generated for my start up costs such as my licensing, ingredients, menus, labels, ovens refrigerated display cases, and other bakery supplies. I've been offered an amazing opportunity to sell my goodies in a new salon that's opening- guaranteed! I'm over the moon that the salon owners love what I make, appreciate the quality of my ingredients and products, and most importantly- believe in me ! I'm so humbled to have this opportunity. Now I just need to raise the capital, apply some love and hard work and live my dream! Thank you for reading my story and for giving your support.

story:
City Fitness Gym is a small business founded in 1983 with the simple beginning of providing on-site fitness instructors to places of business. Considered cutting edge at the time, work site fitness is now considered a mainstay and we have persevered. We provide fitness classes to the US Supreme Court, National Gallery of Art, World Bank, the Holocaust Museum, and the National Zoo to this day.

Our gym has been serving the fitness needs of the Cleveland Park community in Washington, DC for over 21 years. We have awesome long-term members, some of who have been with us since we opened, and this stability and co-support has created a thriving community where we serve people of all ages and abilities. We are a home-away-from-home where members feel safe, connected and welcome.  We maintain a quality member service mindset in an era where customer service has diminished, priding ourselves on providing personal attention.  City Fitness is the "Cheers" of Fitness because, unlike other gyms, we actually “know your name.”

Owned by Dega Schembri and Lucinda LaRee, we are the longest standing woman-owned fitness business in Washington. As owner-operators, we remain fully involved in day-to-day activities as Personal Trainers, Group Fitness Instructors, Member Service Representatives, Managers and CEO's (Chief EVERYTHING Officers). 

City Fitness Gym believes in Doing Well and Doing Good – we have supported many local, national and international charities. We’ve collected food, prom dresses, metro cards, and more for people in need. Through our annual Fitness Fiesta Fundraisers, we have given back to the community at large and locally from the Ugandan Children's Charity Foundation, to Street Soccer USA to Girls On The Run DC. Now, we need your help.

Being small in a world of big box facilities, a woman-owned gym in a male-dominated field, and a friendly, neighborhood business in an ever- growing isolated world, we face the challenge of staying competitive. We have invested in our physical space constantly through the years with new equipment, new floors, painting, updating our accessories, and improving our customer service and staff education. In 2014, we began a major capital improvement campaign: with assistance from the Great Streets Grant we partially refurbished our locker rooms and replaced our aged fitness floor A/V equipment. In 2015, we are poised to finish the locker room upgrades, replace our HVAC system, upgrade our cardiovascular machines and more. The Great Streets Grant will help us with some of this, but we want to do so much more.

You and Your Impact:

We strive to keep our costs competitive, and to do that our budget does not allow for the upgrades to our weight room equipment and other parts of our A/V systems. There are 4 weight room pieces that could be more user-friendly - especially for our more mature members while, at the same time, still serving our elite athletes.  Our televisions are very old and are difficult to see on some cardio machines.

Our campaign to raise $10,000.00 will allow us to begin the effort of replacing these items. We face fierce competition with the ever-growing large chains of the gym industry and struggle to keep up the costly equipment changes needed to stay cutting edge. Help us achieve this goal while still allowing us to optimally service the diverse demographics that our gym proudly attracts.

If we don't reach our goal, we will purchase as many pieces of equipment as we can with the money we raise. So, no amount is too small to help and every bit of it will help with working capital toward our upgrades.

Neighborhood Perks:

We are very happy to provide wonderful perks from the local neighborhood businesses of Cleveland Park as well as from our own staff. As a “Thank You” for your contribution, we are offering discounted personal training packages, massage specials, and much more. Or, give the gift of fitness with a discounted membership! City Fitness Gym is proud to continue to be your neighborhood gym. Lift Locally, Think Globally.


Thank you,

Dega and Lucinda

P.S. - Check out the great "perks" we have collected from our neighbors and friends as well as rewards from our own Personal Trainers! We couldn't have this awesome community without all of you.
story_txt:
City Fitness Gym is a small business founded in 1983 with the simple
beginning of providing on-site fitness instructors to places of business.
Considered cutting edge at the time, work site fitness is now considered a
mainstay and we have persevered. We provide fitness classes to the US Supreme
Court, National Gallery of Art, World Bank, the Holocaust Museum, and the
National Zoo to this day.
Our gym has been serving the fitness needs of the Cleveland Park community
in Washington, DC for over 21 years. We have awesome
long-term members, some of who have been with us since we opened, and this
stability and co-support has created a thriving community where we serve people
of all ages and abilities. We are a home-away-from-home where members feel safe,
connected and welcome.  We maintain a quality member service mindset in an
era where customer service has diminished, priding ourselves on providing
personal attention.  City Fitness is the "Cheers" of
Fitness because, unlike other gyms, we actually “know your name.” Owned by
Dega Schembri and Lucinda LaRee, we are the longest standing woman-owned
fitness business in Washington. As owner-operators, we remain
fully involved in day-to-day activities as Personal Trainers, Group
Fitness Instructors, Member Service Representatives, Managers and CEO's (Chief EVERYTHING Officers).  
City Fitness Gym believes in Doing Well and Doing Good – we have supported many local, national and international charities. We’ve
collected food, prom dresses, metro cards, and more for people in need. Through
our annual Fitness Fiesta Fundraisers, we have given back to the community
at large and locally from the Ugandan Children's Charity Foundation, to Street
Soccer USA to Girls On The Run DC. Now, we need your help.
Being small in a world of big box facilities, a woman-owned gym
in a male-dominated field, and a friendly, neighborhood business in an ever-
growing isolated world, we face the challenge of staying competitive. We have
invested in our physical space constantly through the years with new equipment,
new floors, painting, updating our accessories, and improving our customer
service and staff education. In 2014, we began a major capital improvement
campaign: with assistance from the Great Streets Grant we partially refurbished
our locker rooms and replaced our aged fitness floor A/V equipment. In 2015, we
are poised to finish the locker room upgrades, replace our HVAC system, upgrade
our cardiovascular machines and more. The Great Streets Grant will help us with
some of this, but we want to do so much more. 
You and Your Impact:
We strive to keep our costs competitive, and to do that our budget does not
allow for the upgrades to our weight room equipment and other parts of our A/V
systems. There are 4 weight room pieces that could be more user-friendly -
especially for our more mature members while, at the same time, still serving
our elite athletes.  Our televisions are very old and are difficult to see
on some cardio machines.
Our campaign to raise $10,000.00 will allow us to begin the effort of
replacing these items. We face fierce competition with the ever-growing
large chains of the gym industry and struggle to keep up the costly equipment
changes needed to stay cutting edge. Help us achieve this goal while still
allowing us to optimally service the diverse demographics that our gym
proudly attracts.
If we don't reach our goal, we will purchase as many pieces of equipment as
we can with the money we raise. So, no amount is too small to help and every
bit of it will help with working capital toward our upgrades.
Neighborhood Perks:
We are very happy to provide wonderful perks from the local neighborhood
businesses of Cleveland Park as well as from our own staff. As a “Thank
You” for your contribution, we are offering discounted personal training
packages, massage specials, and much more. Or, give the gift of fitness with a
discounted membership! City Fitness Gym is proud to continue to be your
neighborhood gym. Lift Locally, Think Globally. 

Thank you,
Dega and Lucinda


P.S. - Check out the great "perks" we have collected from our neighbors and friends as well as rewards from our own Personal Trainers! We couldn't have this awesome community without all of you.

story:
Ambrosia Vibe now available at Orgasmatronics.com!

You asked for alternate dildo colors, and we are happy to announce that we can offer a small number of black Ambrosia dildos starting today!

Shop Now >

Success!

The Ambrosia Vibe campaign has been a mind blowing success! You took us to our initial funding goal in the first week, and then blew past the 50K goal like it was standing still. From the bottom of our perverted, little hearts, thank you. We'll be spending the next few weeks getting perk packages organized and Ambrosia bits and pieces ready for assembly and shipping in October.


Ambrosia goes to production!

Thanks to your generous support, the Ambrosia Vibe is no longer a fantasy; it's a reality. Because of you, we reached our minimum funding goal in week 1!

See details in FAQ >

Refer a Friend & Win

Reach the new goals by telling your friends! Use Indiegogo's Share Tools above to qualify, and win sexy prizes. See details in FAQ >

First things first:

1. All backers have the option to remain 100% ANONYMOUS. Simply check “Don’t display my name” when you are making a payment.

2. Science is sexy, but sometimes you want that sexiness to be subtle. We understand. Every order will be shipped via USPS in a discreet, brown box addressed from Boulder Applied Physics (the actual name of our company). Nothing on the outside of your package will identify the fun inside ;)

The Ambrosia Vibe is a new type of strap-on dildo that responds to touch. The unique Ambrosia Pressure Sense Technology™ perceives motion on the dildo and transfers sensation to the user via a vibrator at the base of the unit. The Ambrosia Vibe allows the strap-on wearer to actually "feel" the sexual stimulation applied to the dildo!

We believe this is a game-changing toy with all sorts of awesome possibilities for gender bending and body hacking. Be 1 of 200 people that own the Ambrosia Vibe for $50 off the retail price when you pre-order during our Indiegogo campaign. 

The Ambrosia is specifically designed to be very, very simple to use, to do what all good technology should do: disappear and let the user get on with their business.

“One of the most liberating uses for technology in general is to free individuals from the constraints of their bodies, whether it’s letting us see things hundreds of miles away, fly, or live underwater. Our technology lets people not born with a biological penis have a richer experience as they play with sensation of their new ‘organ.’ We hope that this improves people’s lives and makes them happier with whatever their sexual and gender identity are.” 
--Dr. X. Treme, inventor

Ways to Use | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters

Ambrosia Touch Response: 

A “vein” that senses pressure from massage with the mouth, hand, and other parts of the body runs along the underside of the Ambrosia dildo. The pressure applied to this vein is transmitted via a tube to the control box. The control box measures pressure using some extremely sexy math (see image below), and the bullet vibe in the base of the dildo vibrates in response. The strap-on is designed to be worn in a harness with the base positioned against the wearer’s clitoris, so they can feel the stimulation.



Ways to Play with Ambrosia:

Perfect for pegging. Solo or partnered hand-job. The "two-guy threesome." Buy two and 69. Learn how to "96" in the video below. Invent something new!

To view too-sexy-for-Indiegogo ways to play, please visit orgasmatronics.com.


Sexy Benefits:

Please check out our Perks!


Ways to Use | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters


Why Crowdfund the Ambrosia?

Although we have seen success with our flagship product, the X1 Orgasmatron, we are still just a tiny company- there are less than 10 of us! We are asking for your help in this campaign so that we can:

  1. Cover manufacturing costs. Making stuff is expensive! There are a number of up-front capital investment costs that we need to pay for before we can bring Ambrosia to you. The money raised in this campaign will help us cover prototyping and parts, as well as shipping and consultation fees.  

  2. Support and celebrate sexual and gender diversity. The Ambrosia allows users to play in a completely novel way. Our hope with this toy and this campaign is that we can work together to open up a dialogue about body exploration and build the conversation about intimacy and pleasure.


Ways to Play | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters



Ways to Play | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters


 Dr. X. Treme

Doctor X. Treme is the inventor of our flagship product, the X1 Orgasmatron. He is also CEO and co-founder of Orgasmatronics, Inc.

When Doctor X. Treme was a child he dreamed of becoming an inventor. His aspirations led him to the field of physics and his studies earned him a PhD from Yale University. After graduation the Doctor took a job in a government lab. He spent the next six years erecting quantum measurement devices for low temperature physics. While the work was engaging, Treme found it constricting and oppressive, like wearing pants. He grew weary of the military’s involvement in his field. To the Doctor, applied physics was about more than advanced weaponry.

One fateful night, his wife made a simple request. “Build me a sex machine?” she asked. And just like that, Doctor X. Treme quit his government job, took off his pants, and got to work.

These days, the Doctor dedicates his time to coupling science and technology in the bedroom. He researches ways to use physical principles to enhance the lives of (extra)ordinary people. And in his spare time, he ceaselessly battles injustice while exploring time and space in his unreliable time machine. Okay, that last bit isn’t true... yet.


 Lux Alptraum

Lux Alptraum is a writer, sex educator, and consultant most frequently found at Nerve and WoodRocket. Past projects have included gigs as the editor, publisher, and CEO of Fleshbot, the web’s foremost blog about sexuality and adult entertainment; a sex educator at an adolescent pregnancy prevention program; an HIV pretest counselor; and the founder of ThatStrangeGirl, an alternative porn site, and Boinkology, a blog about sex and culture.


  Alexandra Ars

A. manages the brand, designs the web and brews the tea for Orgasmatronics, Inc. She co-founded the company with Doctor X. Treme. A. used to design for a jewelry company, several bands and, for a little while, Mozilla. But when Dr. X. elucidated his vision of a queer sex toy company while they waded in a freezing river she knew she had to help make the dream a reality.

She is a queer, polyamorous, bespectacled drummer. She believes socks and scarves are the sexiest items of clothing especially when worn exclusively.


 Ma'Belle

Ma'Belle is resident stripper and handler of all things wiry or boxy at Orgasmatronics. Being on Team X. Treme is one of the most satisfying jobs she has ever had. Her R&D ideas are taken seriously, so she can honestly feel like she's positively influencing a product that will bring orgasmic joy to thousands around the world. Ma'Belle has been voraciously exploring and expanding her own sexuality and awareness of others' for about 12 years. Her recent love affairs with bicycles and tranarchafeminism have really made her passions and identities intersectional. She keeps an arsenal of DIY and manufactured sex toys within arm's reach at all times.


﻿ Megan

Megan plays about in various departments at Orgasmatronics. She is an assembler, a shipper, a receiver, an emailer, a data compiler, a writer, a researcher, a social media-er, and if you catch her on a good day, a model. Megan's background is in biology and she is super excited to be working for a company so focused on making science sexy. She enjoys Twizzlers, blanket forts, and drinking things out of pineapples. She hates pants.



 Sabine

Sabine is a part of our marketing team. She is currently focusing on our video production and style as well as honing in on our marketing strategies and execution. With a background in Performance Art and Art History, Sabine has a unique approach to research and aesthetics.

In the past, Sabine has spent far too much of her income on fine lingerie. Her belief is that even if she’s wearing a

sweat-suit from the '80s she can still feel sexy knowing that she’s got something nice on underneath.


Ways to Play | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters



“Almost as good as a 2 guy threesome.” -Rachel from Denver


“I love how the Ambrosia has opened up conversations about sexuality and gender identity with my friends.” -Alexandra Ars


“Obviously, this is a pretty awesome and groundbreaking idea, with all sorts of awesome possibilities for gender bending and body hacking.” - Lux Alptraum


"I've never been super excited to wear a strap-on. It's more of a psychological pleasure than an actual, physical pleasure. But with the Ambrosia I look forward to it now." - Selina Kyl


"You have created quite the "buzz" in the lesbian community." - Dr. Annise Mabry from Lezmysterybox


Ways to Play | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters


Q. When will I receive my order?

A. Our estimated shipping date is October 2014.

Once our campaign is completed, we will begin bulk production of the Ambrosia. We are estimating 12 weeks for parts delivery, assembly, and quality control testing. Check this campaign page for updates.


Q. Where is my money going?

A. The Ambrosia Vibe is completely developed. This campaign is raising funds strictly to bring the product to you. The more we raise, the more we can give you. Scroll down to find out what you get if we surpass our 32K initial funding goal. 

  • 5k for dildos

  • 12k for control boxes

  • 6k for prototyping

  • 2k for indiegogo and paypal

  • 5k for paying all consultants


Q. What are the Ambrosia Vibe specs?

A. Ambrosia dildo

  • Length about 5"
  • Diameter about 1.1"
  • Circumference pi*d about 3.5"

Q. What are the stretch goals?

A. The more we raise, the more you get!

  • At 50K everyone who purchased or purchases "Harness the Pleasure" will be upgraded to the vegan Stealth Harness from ASLAN Leather!

  • At 75K, as you requested, everyone who purchased or purchases the Ambrosia Vibe at any perk level will get to a choice of the original purple or a new black dildo color.

  • At 100K a new perk will be unlocked with the Ambrosia Vibe + a compatible, stronger vibrator: the X1 Orgasmatron gyrator. 

  • At 150K everyone who purchased "The Ambrosia Vibe" ($149 & higher) will also get a second, larger Ambrosia dildo.

  • At 200K everyone who purchased "The Ambrosia Vibe" ($149 & higher) will also get a third, anatomical Ambrosia dildo.


Q. What are the shipping costs? Is International Shipping an option?

A. All shipping in the US is free of charge. We are happy to ship Internationally but ask that you add additional monies to your contribution to help us cover costs. $35 USD for Canadian orders; $50 USD for all other.


Q. How does the purchase appear on a credit card bill or bank statement?

A. The purchase will appear on any bill or statement as Boulder Applied Physics.


Q. Do I need to sign up for PayPal to donate?

A. No! Any standard credit or debit card can be used through the PayPal gateway. Simply select the choice for people who do not have a PayPal account and enter your credit card information as you normally would.


Q. What will Erika Moen's one-of-a-kind, Oh Joy Sex Toy watercolor illustration based on X1 Orgasmatron comic review look like?

A.


Q. What will my Less Pants, More Science t-shirt look like?

A.


Q. What will my Less Pants, More Science button look like?

A.


Q. What will my harness look like?

A. Below is the adjustable harness that comes with your "Harness the Pleasure" perk. The Ambrosia dildo and battery pack both fit this and many other types of harnesses. 

The Ambrosia campaign reached 50K, so all harnesses included with your "Harness the Pleasure" perk have been upgraded to the high quality, vegan Stealth Harness from Aslan Leather pictured below! Hip size adjustable from 26" - 56". BPA and Phalate free. 


Q. What is the anticipated retail cost of the Ambrosia?

A. The Ambrosia will be sold for $199. You save $50 (or more!) with your contribution today.


Q. Does the Ambrosia come with a warranty?

A. Yes! We offer a one-year replacement warranty on all our products.


Q. Is the Ambrosia patented?

A. Patents pending! 


Q. What future Ambrosia technology innovations can I expect?

A. We started simple, with something we know is super fun. But where can we go?  

1. Compatibility with more intense vibrators like the X1 Orgasmatron gyrator which is similar in strength to the Hitachi Magic Wand. 

2. Long distance play (teledildonics)

Once a signal is digital you can do anything with it: bluetooth, xbee, internet, local mesh networks of users all in the same room; anything you can imagine with networks of sensors and actuators is possible.  

3. Drink pouring robot controller

4. LED displays like the Hammer

5. Computer game inputs

6. Flame throwing art exhibits

7. Other strap-ons that are touch responsive using Ambrosia Pressure Sense Technology™ including hands and alien body parts (Ferengi ears that really work, anyone?).

Q. What can I win if I refer my friends?

A. To show our appreciation for your contributions, we want to offer you bonus rewards for referring your friends. To qualify, make sure you are logged into your account and use Indiegogo's Share Tools above.

Prize 1: First 50 people to refer a friend who donates $29 (or more), 
Get 1-month subscription to Courtney Trouble's IndiePornRevolution.

Prize 2: Bring in $300 worth of referrals, Get Less Pants, More Science tee.

Prize 3: Bring in the most referrals, Get X1 Orgasmatron Pleasure System! 

X1 Orgasmatron is our strong gyrator toy. A $300 value, all yours, all for telling your friends about the awesomeness that is the Ambrosia Vibe.


Ways to Play | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters


Special thanks to those who helped make the Ambrosia Vibe and this campaign a reality!

  • Tim Davids and Selina Kyl for campaign video

  • Kari Marie for Ambrosia prototype photography

  • JazzHands Productions for 3D model video

  • D. Eisenstat for music in 3D model video

  • Kevin MacLeod for Go Cart music in campaign video (incompetech.com).

  • Pink & White Productions for donating Crashpad Series DVDs

  • Courtney Trouble for donating indiepornrevolution subscriptions

  • Rachel Kramer Bussel for donating The Big Book of Orgasms: 69 Sexy Stories

  • Erika Moen for donating a one-of-a-kind, hand drawn, Oh Joy Sex Toy comic illustration

  • Mar for the Less Pants, More Science t-shirt design

  • The Concoctory Hackerspace in Denver for providing a creative, queer community space for Dr. X. Treme to invent and 3D print the Ambrosia Vibe bionic strap-on

  • Buck Angel for donating signed copies of Sexing the Transman XXX film.

At 50K everyone who purchased or purchases "Harness the Pleasure" will be upgraded to the vegan Stealth Harness from ASLAN Leather!


At 75K, as you requested, everyone who purchased or purchases the Ambrosia Vibe at any perk level will get to a choice of the original purple or a new black dildo color.


At 100K a new perk will be unlocked with the Ambrosia Vibe + a compatible, stronger vibrator: the X1 Orgasmatron gyrator. 
At 150K everyone who purchased "The Ambrosia Vibe" ($149 & higher) will also get a second, larger Ambrosia dildo.
At 200K everyone who purchased "The Ambrosia Vibe" ($149 & higher) will also get a third, anatomical Ambrosia dildo.
Q. What are the shipping costs? Is International Shipping an option? A. All shipping in the US is free of charge. We are happy to ship Internationally but ask that you add additional monies to your contribution to help us cover costs. $35 USD for Canadian orders; $50 USD for all other. Q. How does the purchase appear on a credit card bill or bank statement?A. The purchase will appear on any bill or statement as Boulder Applied Physics.Q. Do I need to sign up for PayPal to donate?A. No! Any standard credit or debit card can be used through the PayPal gateway. Simply select the choice for people who do not have a PayPal account and enter your credit card information as you normally would.Q. What will Erika Moen's one-of-a-kind, Oh Joy Sex Toy watercolor illustration based on X1 Orgasmatron comic review look like?A. Q. What will my Less Pants, More Science t-shirt look like?A.Q. What will my Less Pants, More Science button look like?A.Q. What will my harness look like?A. Below is the adjustable harness that comes with your "Harness the Pleasure" perk. The Ambrosia dildo and battery pack both fit this and many other types of harnesses. The Ambrosia campaign reached 50K, so all harnesses included with your "Harness the Pleasure" perk have been upgraded to the high quality, vegan Stealth Harness from Aslan Leather pictured below! Hip size adjustable from 26" - 56". BPA and Phalate free. Q. What is the anticipated retail cost of the Ambrosia?A. The Ambrosia will be sold for $199. You save $50 (or more!) with your contribution today.Q. Does the Ambrosia come with a warranty?A. Yes! We offer a one-year replacement warranty on all our products. Q. Is the Ambrosia patented?A. Patents pending! Q. What future Ambrosia technology innovations can I expect?A. We started simple, with something we know is super fun. But where can we go?  1. Compatibility with more intense vibrators like the X1 Orgasmatron gyrator which is similar in strength to the Hitachi Magic Wand. 2. Long distance play (teledildonics)Once a signal is digital you can do anything with it: bluetooth, xbee, internet, local mesh networks of users all in the same room; anything you can imagine with networks of sensors and actuators is possible.  3. Drink pouring robot controller4. LED displays like the Hammer5. Computer game inputs6. Flame throwing art exhibits7. Other strap-ons that are touch responsive using Ambrosia Pressure Sense Technology™ including hands and alien body parts (Ferengi ears that really work, anyone?).Q. What can I win if I refer my friends?A. To show our appreciation for your contributions, we want to offer you bonus rewards for referring your friends. To qualify, make sure you are logged into your account and use Indiegogo's Share Tools above.Prize 1: First 50 people to refer a friend who donates $29 (or more), Get 1-month subscription to Courtney Trouble's IndiePornRevolution.Prize 2: Bring in $300 worth of referrals, Get Less Pants, More Science tee.Prize 3: Bring in the most referrals, Get X1 Orgasmatron Pleasure System! X1 Orgasmatron is our strong gyrator toy. A $300 value, all yours, all for telling your friends about the awesomeness that is the Ambrosia Vibe.Ways to Play | Why | Technology | Team | People are Saying | FAQs | Supporters
Special thanks to those who helped make the Ambrosia Vibe and this campaign a reality!

Kari Marie for Ambrosia prototype photography
JazzHands Productions for 3D model video
D. Eisenstat for music in 3D model video
Kevin MacLeod for Go Cart music in campaign video (incompetech.com).
Pink & White Productions for donating Crashpad Series DVDs
Courtney Trouble for donating indiepornrevolution subscriptions
Rachel Kramer Bussel for donating The Big Book of Orgasms: 69 Sexy Stories
Erika Moen for donating a one-of-a-kind, hand drawn, Oh Joy Sex Toy comic illustration
Mar for the Less Pants, More Science t-shirt design
The Concoctory Hackerspace in Denver for providing a creative, queer community space for Dr. X. Treme to invent and 3D print the Ambrosia Vibe bionic strap-on
Buck Angel for donating signed copies of Sexing the Transman XXX film.

story:
Short Summary

Jacqueline Homan, a resident of Erie, Pennsylvania,  is a "pre-movement survivor" which means that she was trafficked before anyone really knew or even had a term for it. Orphaned at the young age of 12, Jacqueline and her sister were forced against their will to have sex with thousands of men. If they resisted, they were beaten and gang raped. At the age of 17, Jacqueline managed to escape her captors only to spend the rest of her life in abject poverty struggling every day to survive, unable to obtain gainful employment due to an un-expunged prostitution record and permanent debilitating physical injuries from sexual trauma with no access to adequate medical care. 

In spite of her constant hardships, Jacqueline has become a voice for thousands of trafficking survivors around the country. Her activism has brought awareness to this complex problem and opened the eyes of the United States Public in terms of barriers, economic obstacles, and a social stigma that comes with a painful past. 

In her home state of Pennsylvania, which just received an F on its sex trafficking report card, Jacqueline is denied health care, financial support and services, and turned away from even minimum wage employment due to her criminal record, a record that she obtained before she was even old enough to consent. 

Now at the age of 47, and through the generous help of advocate and activist, Ed Drain, a military vet, Jacqueline has finally begun to learn and make a small income in the IT field. Unfortunately, due to lack of income over 30 years, Jacqueline has been unable to make timely electrical and structural repairs to her residence and one of the buildings next to her main house on her property. Recently, she was given a code citation and ordered to demolish the outbuilding (formerly a machine shop run by her deceased husband who willed her the property) within 30 days. 

Currently, the main building on the property, where she resides, does not have electricity. Ever resilient, Jacqueline uses the out building to get electricity into her home. Electricity that enables her to continue striving towards self sufficiency as well as the opportunity to create a national non-profit that will provide safe housing as well as job training to other sex trafficking survivors. If she loses her residence, Jacqueline will become homeless and unable to continue working towards realizing her dream of helping others. 

Your donations will go towards restoring electricity to the main house as well as the demolition of the outbuilding (which is a code violation due to the roof caving in) and enable Jacqueline to help other sex trafficking survivors gain job skills and life saving shelter in her home. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • 12,000 of the 75,000 will go to electrical repairs in the main house
  • 38,000 of the 75,000 will be for the demolition and asbestos waste removal of the collapsing 30' x 48' outbuilding (per Code Enforcement Order)
  • 12.5%  of monies raised, or approximately, 10,000 dollars, will be paid to indiegogo as commission 
  • ALL fundraised monies regardless of whether we reach our goal or not, will go towards electrical repairs and payments towards legally mandated demolition 

The Impact 

The sex trade generates 32 Billion Dollars Worldwide. Every year in the United States 300,000 women, men and children are trafficked into the sex trade. Criminals are turning more and more to human trafficking and the reason is simple economics. While drugs and weapons may only be sold once, a human being may be sold thousands of times. 

Trafficking victims who manage to survive this sexual and emotional trauma are then re-traumatized by a society that offers little to no help rebuilding their lives. Jacqueline and other survivors like her are not lazy moochers who want to suck the system dry. They, like everyone else, want gainful employment that will allow them even the most basic necessities, such as basic shelter, food, and access to medical care services. Without the ability to get a job due to an unexpunged prostitution record from when they were minors, plus ongoing health problems as a result of being sex trafficked, most survivors can't even get a minimum wage job to pay for these basic needs. 

They are then forced to rely on the kindness of others who are more fortunate then they are in the form of fundraisers like this one. If you help Jacqueline rebuild and remain in her home, you will be empowering a sex trafficking survivor activist and ensure that she will be able to continue working towards becoming financially self sufficient. In addition, by helping Jacqueline, you are also helping other survivors who will benefit from her IT training and safe harbor in her home as she "pays it forward." 

Please don't let a powerful light for social change go out. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help with monetary donations, we understand! There are other ways to help. You can:

  • Share the campaign on your social media platforms
  • Tell your friends and family about the campaign
  • Help out with donations of contractor labor and/or materials
  • Help out with donations of electrical labor and/or materials

Thank you in advance for your time and attention to the needs of sex trafficking survivors! We appreciate you!

story:
Hello All.  My name is Tiffini.  I'm originally from Grinnell, Iowa, but have been living in Des Moines, Iowa for about 3 years now. I'm currently a student of mortuary science at Des Moines Area Community College with an anticipated graduation date of May 2014.  Being in this profession is something I've always wanted to do, but didn't have the guts for until I was laid off from my job on December 31, 2010.  And if I was having any doubts about this profession, those were squashed when my father passed away at the age of 57 from sudden cardiac death on August 3rd, 2011. The funeral home that handled his final wishes was comforting and competent, and I want to be able to provide that service to others that are grieving.  

This campaign has the potential to give me my life back.  

Way back when, when I was just 12 years old, a little friend visited me.  The same friend that visits all girls that age.  My... *shhhhh*... period.  I'll try to keep the graphic details to a minimum, but make no promises.  

It wasn't anything like those little films they show to kids.  There was no celebration, no hugs from family and friends because I'd "become a woman." BAH.  There was just tooth grinding pain.  For several years I just dealt with it, occassionally complaining to my mom about how much it hurt.  Sometimes, if I couldn't stop crying and screaming from the hurt, she'd let me stay home from school.  

When I reached high school I talked to my doctor about my situation and she gave me birth control pills.  This helped take the edge off, but I still cringed with fear every 28 days and still had to miss class occassionally.  When I entered college in 2000, I was put on a different kind of birth control pill.  This one did a slightly better job at keeping the pain and bleeding under control.  Throughout college I was plagued by lady issues of a yeasty and bacterial nature.  

Out of college, things started to get more serious, pain and bleeding wise.  I asked a gynecologist if I could have a laparoscopy done to check for anything abnormal, but was told my symptoms didn't really warrant the surgery.  I saw about 5 more doctors after that.  One told me I was fine.  Another told me it was in my head.  Another ordered a transvaginal ultrasound.  When I asked for the results, I was told everything was fine and led out of the room.

In 2007 I finally got my way after LOTS of complaining.  My doctor sent me to a specialist for a laparoscopy referral.  The doctor I saw didn't seem to take me seriously at first, but then she got a fax from the office that had done my ultrasound.  She asked if I had ever been told what the results were.  I let her know they told me everything was a-okay.  She freaked out.  She told me I had nodes all over my uterus and ovaries that could be a whole range of problems, so I had the laparoscopy.  Inside they found stage 3 endometriosis, with the buildup of adhesions on my left ovary being so thick that it was literally stuck on my uterus.  

Immediately after the surgery I was put on a high dose of progesterone to make my lady flow stop.  Any bleeding would bring more adhesions, more problems, and more pain.  I was completely happy with this until I noticed my clothes started getting smaller.  I was avidly exercising, switching between swimming, weight training, treadmill and arc trainer.  I was in good health at about 170-175 lbs.  After a couple months of hormones I had put on 15 pounds.  I read several forums regarding gaining weight on this particular drug, and 20 pounds seemed to be the limit for weight gain for everyone else.  I was fine with that, just as long as my pain was gone, but after a year, it stopped working.  I was put on a drug called Danazol that filled me with androgens, (male hormones).  This completely eliminated pain and bleeding, but it made me crazy.  I was only on it for a couple months before I had to stop.  It made me violent and depressed.  I was put back on progesterone, along with some strong narcotics for the pain.  I was loopy all the time, which didn't always work well in an office setting.  

In the meantime, I was putting on more weight and having to buy bigger clothes.  I was NOT happy.  

In 2009 I moved to Des Moines and found a doctor that was willing to perform a hysterectomy to end my suffering and potential pain killer addiction.  I had the surgery December 4th, and I've never regretted a thing....

Except....

I was 27 when I had my full hysterectomy and was thrown into full blown menopause.  I started an HRT regimen, but because endometriosis is fed by estrogen, and likely caused by excessive estrogen, I couldn't have much in the way of hormones.  Hot flashes, mood swings, night sweats, insomnia... all of these I could have dealt with, but my body seemed to think rapidly gaining weight should be added to the pile of symptoms.  

I was determined to get myself back down to 170, since after starting hormones and going through the surgery I ballooned up to 210.  I joined a gym and started working out for 2 to 3 hours every night after work, doing cardio and weight training.  This started to burn me out, so I cut down to 45 minutes, 3 days a week.  I was still seeing weight creeping on, so I took more drastic measures and joined Farrell's XTreme Body Shaping.  The classes were fantastic and really challenging.  I thought for sure this would be the key to getting my weight down, but at week 5 I was the only person in the class that had gained 20 pounds.  I was baffled.  I was following the diet, doing the routine... what else was I supposed to do??  Well, I wanted to keep going and finish strong, but I rolled my ankle pretty severely during week 6.  It was over for me after that.  I tried to tape it and go back to class after a week, but it was much too painful.  I was interested in the maintenance classes, but they were too expensive for me. 

I went to see my doctor about my ankle and she scolded me for doing such vigorous activity.  She said I should avoid high impact stuff since low estrogen weakens your joints, and my estrogen was in such short supply.  

I switched to walking a couple miles several times a week and got a BodyBugg system and a pen and notepad so I could track what I was burning and what I was eating.  I kept my doctor in the loop since I was kind of interested in having a lap band put in.  I followed the BodyBugg program religiously for several months, but ended up gaining more weight.  I was around 280 at this point.  

Being that heavy was making exercise difficult.  I tried yoga, but couldn't do the moves because my belly and breasts were in the way.  I tried to keep walking, but my bad ankle always hurt and my knees hurt from the weight.  My bra size had grown from a 38 D to a 46 G.  I opted to try water exercise at the Y.  I've gotta admit, it's my favorite work out.  I can have hot flashes until my hypothalamus is content, but I stay cool as a cucumber.  My joints don't hurt, and no one can see how much you're jiggling when you're underwater.  

So, right now, at this very moment, I weigh about 330 lbs, and it makes me sick.  All of my efforts seem to have been in vain.  I hate myself.  I hate the way I look.  I don't want to go out in public.  I don't want people to see me and jump to conclusions about why I'm so heavy.  I don't like worrying about whether I'm going fit in the seats at the symphony, or at a restaurant, etc.  I don't want to be intimate with my boyfriend.  

My doctor says I'm in hormone Hades and has suggested I have gastric bypass.  Her theory is, my body was producing excess estrogen, causing the endometriosis.  Surgical menopause completely shut down my estrogen production, and I'm getting back very little with HRT.  The only other source of estrogen is from body tissues, i.e., fat.  So my body stockpiles fat in order to produce more estrogen.  I'm willing to do what it takes and have gone through the classes at Mercy Bariatric Center.  I meet all the requirements for the surgery, but my insurance company turned me down.  The bariatric center appealed their decision but they still denied it.  The nurses I spoke to said the decision was very fishy and that they seemed to be giving me the run around.  I'll be switching insurance companies soon, but the process of waiting is making me crazy.  

I feel like I'm watching sand slipping through an hour glass.  Since putting on this weight I've struggled to keep my cholesterol and triglycerides down, I've developed sleep apnea, my hot flashes have tripled in intensity, and I'm terrified I'll become diabetic or have a heart attack at the age of 30.  Heredity is not on my side here.  As I mentioned before, my father passed away last August from sudden cardiac death.  Heart disease and diabetes are rampant in my family.  

I just want to be healthy.  I don't want to be a shut in.  I want to exercise knowing that it's actually benefitting my body, not making my hips and knees fall apart.  I want to feel sexy.  I want to go out in public with my boyfriend and not feel like everyone is staring at him because he's with some fat chick.  I want to be able to shop at the mall again, and not special fat girl stores.  I want to feel like I have a future.  

I'm asking for $30,000 to fund gastric bypass surgery; the procedure, anesthesia, and hospital stay.  I'm asking for my life back.  All of the funds received will go to Mercy Bariatric Center in Des Moines to pay for the procedure.  If I don't meet my goal, the funds will be used in a couple of ways.  Paying insurance premiums for a new provider, and a program called Optifast, a prepackaged meal program that is monitored by a hospital nutritionist.  Hopefully this would make me more appealing to my insurance company.   (http://www.mercydesmoines.org/weightreduction/serv_weight_optifast.cfm)

Please look through my gallery of photos.  They span from before I started hormone therapy to April of 2012.  There's a pretty great photo of my wounded ankle tucked in there as well. 

If you're interested in reading my blog, please click on the "website" link below, but be warned!  I curse like a sailor and vent all of my feelings of frustration there.  Read at your own risk.  My youtube account isn't anything special.  Just a bunch of clips from the Golden Girls that cheer me up, and some videos of me singing recently.  

If you're unable to donate, please spread the word.  Maybe you know someone that's been through the same thing, whether it be gaining weight and losing self-esteem, or battling surgical menopause.

I switched to walking a couple miles several times a week and got a BodyBugg system and a pen and notepad so I could track what I was burning and what I was eating.  I kept my doctor in the loop since I was kind of interested in having a lap band put in.  I followed the BodyBugg program religiously for several months, but ended up gaining more weight.  I was around 280 at this point.

So, right now, at this very moment, I weigh about 330 lbs, and it makes me sick.  All of my efforts seem to have been in vain.  I hate myself.  I hate the way I look.  I don't want to go out in public.  I don't want people to see me and jump to conclusions about why I'm so heavy.  I don't like worrying about whether I'm going fit in the seats at the symphony, or at a restaurant, etc.  I don't want to be intimate with my boyfriend.  
My doctor says I'm in hormone Hades and has suggested I have gastric bypass.  Her theory is, my body was producing excess estrogen, causing the endometriosis.  Surgical menopause completely shut down my estrogen production, and I'm getting back very little with HRT.  The only other source of estrogen is from body tissues, i.e., fat.  So my body stockpiles fat in order to produce more estrogen.  I'm willing to do what it takes and have gone through the classes at Mercy Bariatric Center.  I meet all the requirements for the surgery, but my insurance company turned me down.  The bariatric center appealed their decision but they still denied it.  The nurses I spoke to said the decision was very fishy and that they seemed to be giving me the run around.  I'll be switching insurance companies soon, but the process of waiting is making me crazy.  
I feel like I'm watching sand slipping through an hour glass.  Since putting on this weight I've struggled to keep my cholesterol and triglycerides down, I've developed sleep apnea, my hot flashes have tripled in intensity, and I'm terrified I'll become diabetic or have a heart attack at the age of 30.  Heredity is not on my side here.  As I mentioned before, my father passed away last August from sudden cardiac death.  Heart disease and diabetes are rampant in my family.  
I just want to be healthy.  I don't want to be a shut in.  I want to exercise knowing that it's actually benefitting my body, not making my hips and knees fall apart.  I want to feel sexy.  I want to go out in public with my boyfriend and not feel like everyone is staring at him because he's with some fat chick.  I want to be able to shop at the mall again, and not special fat girl stores.  I want to feel like I have a future.  
I'm asking for $30,000 to fund gastric bypass surgery; the procedure, anesthesia, and hospital stay.  I'm asking for my life back.  All of the funds received will go to Mercy Bariatric Center in Des Moines to pay for the procedure.  If I don't meet my goal, the funds will be used in a couple of ways.  Paying insurance premiums for a new provider, and a program called Optifast, a prepackaged meal program that is monitored by a hospital nutritionist.  Hopefully this would make me more appealing to my insurance company.   (http://www.mercydesmoines.org/weightreduction/serv_weight_optifast.cfm)
Please look through my gallery of photos.  They span from before I started hormone therapy to April of 2012.  There's a pretty great photo of my wounded ankle tucked in there as well. 
If you're interested in reading my blog, please click on the "website" link below, but be warned!  I curse like a sailor and vent all of my feelings of frustration there.  Read at your own risk.  My youtube account isn't anything special.  Just a bunch of clips from the Golden Girls that cheer me up, and some videos of me singing recently.  
If you're unable to donate, please spread the word.  Maybe you know someone that's been through the same thing, whether it be gaining weight and losing self-esteem, or battling surgical menopause.

story:
Prevention of a terminal child!

  • My name is Dan Kooyman my infant son passed away 3 years ago.
  • I need 13,000 in order to try to have a healthy child. I had a son born with a very rare Genetic Disorder that is terminal. He passed away after 41 days
  • My wife and I a looking to raise 13,000 dollars
  • There has been less that 150 documented cases in the world of this.
  • We are both carriers and if we have another child there is a 25% chance it would happen again without genetic screening.
  • We have spent 23,000 all of our savings to do INVITRO with Genentic screening but we were unsucessful.
  • The doctors are willing to drop the cost this time to  13,000 and believe it will work this time.

We are looking for 13,000 dollars and all of that will go to pay the doctors and medicine and the genentic testing.

  • We have used everything we have and just really want a chance at a healthy child.
  • Any money that is collected will go towards this. 100%
  • Any money that we do not use we will donate to the RCDP fund.

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • This would allow my wife and I the chance for another child that is healthy this time.
  • This procedure that screens out the embroys allows us to know that any that are implanted are free from the Terminal condidtion.http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cG01G-Kvs3Y&list=UUO2BKjvkdw1ofLFsOOXG0BQ&index=10&feature=plcp

Please let people on Facebook know share the videos:

  • Please if you or anyone you know can help anything will help.
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

On August 28, 2012, 27 year old Sonali Mukherjee began one of many surgeries (involving eye operations and hair and ear transplants) to help reconstruct her face. It melted 9 years ago, after 3 men poured acid on her while she slept. This was in response to her fending off their relentless sexual advances as she made her way to school every morning. In india this type of harassment that women face is called 'eve teasing.'

Before it all happened, Sonali was studying sociology, she was a happy 17-year old. She no longer studies sociology, nor does she retain much happiness. But she's still got her spirit and a strong desire to pursue her education. Sonali has now petitioned her government to either help her find justice or give her the right to die. 

For six of the last nine years, her assailants have been walking the streets. Sonali and her family, bankrupted paying for her care, had to move villages after they were threatened by the men when they returned. She has persistently appealed to the Indian justice system for medical assistance and stricter penalties for assailants, and a fund has been created to cover the expense of her medical care.

She isn't alone, however. In Columbia  there were at least 150 acid-throwing incidents last year, women like 51-year old Consuela Cordoba wear masks every day of their lives. In England, Katie Piper (a model) was doused in acid after a rejected ex-boyfriend hired someone to attack her. In Afganistan, schoolgirls are habitually subjected to acid throwing. In Pakistan, 10-year old Zaib Aslam thought someone had lit her face on fire when men on motorcycles threw acid on her face as she waited with her mother at a bus stop. In Rome last year, after 38 grueling surgeries, 33-year old Fakhra Youan finally committed suicide, 10 years after she was assaulted in this way. Only a few of countless incidents mentioned here.

The state of India, in collusion with Sonali's assailants, has stood by and allowed multiple injustices to occur. It has failed to protect Sonali and other women like her and to adequately protect their rights under the law.

There are sections of the law that make gestures or acts intended to insult the modesty of a woman or acts intrude upon her privacy a crime. The provisions under these sections and the procedural laws are complex and the type of proof that is required make it very difficult to get assailants punished.

Section 509- Whoever, intending to insult the modesty of any woman, utters any word makes any sound or gesture, or exhibits any object, intending that such word or sound shall be heard, or that such gesture or object shall be seen, by such woman, or intrudes upon the privacy of such woman, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

Section 354- Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman, intending to outrage or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby outrage her modesty, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or with both.

But one year. Two years. Even six. Is that good enough? Ask yourself. Say, in response to your fiancee's, your girlfriend's, your wife's, your daughter's, your sister's, or your mother's LIFETIME of misery? Her distress? Her shame? Her desire to kill herself in response to the physical and emotional harassment of three men freely walking the streets after only a few years? Think about it...........

The press has extensive coverage on this issue. YouTube Sonali Mukherjee for more than a dozen videos.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently Sonali is scheduled for numerous surgeries to get her back on her feet - the one we are raising funds for is- Release of burn contracture, local soft tissue rearrangement and skin grafting to allow neck mobility. It requires approx. $10,000 USD. The money raised will be remitted to her father who currently handles all her affairs.

Please feel free to contact us with any further questions @ 516 477-4750 or Ovship@aol.com.

story:
The Facts

Credit for this image: https://www.militarymentalhealth.org/militaryptsd

My Story

I deployed in February of 2011 to Kunduz Provence, Afghanistan. I experienced my traumatic event around July of 2011. I noticed after that event that my sleep was greatly disturbed, I was having constant dreams of drowning in blood. But I sucked it up and didn't let it interfere with my job . I redeployed back to Germany in January 2012. I noticed my sleeping was off but I believed it was just my body adjusting to the time zone. I didn't notice the effect of the PTSD until I PCSD to Fort Riley, Kansas in September of 2012. I noticed my depression, self worth, attitude, and just everything that made me happy was in a really dark place. I was having flashbacks at training events and just being around other fellow soldiers. There were time were I would have full blown panic attack by just putting on my physical training uniform, to the point where I would vomit, get light headed and have to sit down because of the dizziness. I would sometimes lock myself in my closet and breakdown because all I could see was death when I closed my eyes.That is when I attended a Tempered Steel brief and just listening to all these soldiers talking about their experiences and being able to relate to them helped me see the problem in me. I seeked help after that. Everything kept adding up to the point were I attempted suicide for the first time. I was hospitalized for 15 days and was then released. I got hospitalized a second time for attempting suicide, but this time it was because the medication was off and I was still having all the same symptoms. I married my wife on May 25, 2013. I deployed again in June of 2013 to Africa for 6 months. I believed that I had my symptoms under control but in February of 2014 my grandfather passed so I went home on emergency leave and helped finance and coordinate for the funeral. My depression was bad but I came back and went to a month long training event in Fort Polk, LA. About 5 days into it and battling with all my symptoms coming back, I blacked out and ended up cutting myself. This lead to my third 15 day hospitalization in Louisiana. I came back to Fort Riley after that and got sent to a month long intense PTSD treatment program in Kansas City, Missouri. That is where I learned that art helped me bring back a piece of me. I noticed a great improvement in my attitude. I was able to create and get my frustrations out with woodwork. My wife noticed it too and supported with anything that I needed. Now I'm in the process of getting Medboarded for my conditions. I am trying to save as much money as I can so I can ease the transition for my wife and myself but that means that I don't have money left to buy tools and materials to keep my woodwork going. 

Extended Story


My Family 

Why The Campaign? 

Yes, This campaign is to help buy tools and materials for me to continue woodwork but it is also to raise awareness and hopefully open a discussion with people suffering from a mental illness with their loved ones. All donations that exceed the set amount will be used to buy equipment (camera, mics, editing software, etc)  to better spread the stories of PTSD sufferers (civilians/military), set up a website, start my own organization for mental illness, and also donate to Tempered Steel and helpingveterans.org. 


Future Aspirations and Goals

My goal after the Military is to give back, I would like to head to college and study Social Work so I can work for or hopefully run my own PTSD Clinic. I would like to introduce Art/Craft therapy to PTSD sufferers.

If you cannot donate please spread the word. Thank you 


Stretch Goal

The stretch goal is $1000 to buy good camera equipment to better film and spread the stories of others. We can make this happen.  


Perks

$100 Perk 

$70 Perk 

$35 Perk

story:
Next year I'm thrilled to be cheerleading at Brigham Young University.  Each team member is asked to raise $600 that will go towards competitions, uniforms, and travel.  A big thank you to everyone who has supported me in reaching this goal of making the BYU Cheer team, I'm so excited to start this next chapter of my life!  

Thank you so much for donations of any size, anything helps!

story:
Flaredown has launched! You can create a free account now.

Sign up at flaredown.com

We can still use your support! Currently we pay for server and development costs out-of-pocket. Every donation helps.

Below is the original IndieGoGo campaign. With your feedback, the app has improved since this pitch.
--------------------------------------

Flaredown is a website and mobile app that makes it easy to visualize your health and your treatments. It's also the first community of patients gathering research-backed data to establish how well treatments work in the real world, and uncover the best new ones.


Flaredown is built by patients, for patients. It will be free, forever.


How It Works

It couldn't be more simple: each day you log in to Flaredown it will ask you a few questions about your illness. That's it! It takes about 30 seconds.

The questions you see are specific to your illness and come from formulas that medical researchers use right now to rate the severity of a patient's condition. Flaredown will take your answers, crunch the numbers, and graph your illness activity over time.

Now when you wonder what's causing you to feel bad you can go back through a complete, visual history of your illness and see clearly what triggered your symptoms, and how well your treatments are really working.

Every patient is different so we don't limit the treatments you can track. Medication or natural remedy, you just give it a name and Flaredown will start recording it.

Since you have all this cool data, Flaredown can print it out in a format that's ready to show to your doctor. The average appointment lasts about 15 minutes and they have to make decisions that will affect your health for months, a detailed history printout helps give them all the info they need to make the best choices with you.

Flaredown learns from the data it gets and shares that knowledge with you in the Insights section. You'll see all the treatments and triggers patients are tracking right now, and stats showing how Flaredown users have responded to them. 

Each treatment/trigger page has a discussion section where you can talk directly with other patients about their experience with the topic, because there's more to managing chronic illness than statistics alone can show.

You Decide What We Research

As patients we have a lot of theories that have never been properly tested. You can see it all over the internet--people are taking their questions to social networks and forums everywhere.

We are the first community focused on finding evidence-based answers to the questions patients are asking right now. That's because Flaredown learns specifically about the things patients choose to track.

Are Lupus patients worried about stress? We'll learn exactly how much it affects Lupus disease activity on average. Are Fibromyalgia patients taking low dose naltrexone? We'll tell you how effective it is in the real world. We even plan to bring in researchers for in-depth studies and release reports to you on a special section of the site.

You can opt out your data and use Flaredown solely for tracking, but we hope you'll consider contributing. This is our bid for patient-first research, and we want you to be a part of it.

Learn about the details of our approach here: flaredown.com/data


Flaredown Is For All Chronic Conditions

We currently have specialized check-ins for Crohn's Disease and Rheumatoid Arthritis, and our primary concern after launch is to extend that to new illnesses rapidly. Here are some that we have in mind:

AutoImmune and Inflammatory
  • Crohn's/Ulcerative Colitis/IBD
  • Rheumatoid/Reactive Arthritis
  • Lupus Erythematosus
  • Multiple Sclerosis
  • RSD/CRPS
  • Sjögren's Syndrome
  • Raynaud's
  • Psoriasis
  • Sarcoidosis
  • Type 1 Diabetes
  • Graves' Disease
  • Hashimoto's Thyroiditis
  • Addison's Disease
  • Myasthenia Gravis
  • Pernicious Anemia
  • Celiac Disease
  • Dermatomyositis and Polymyositis
  • Interstitial Cystitis
  • Ankylosing Spondylitis
Invisible Illnesses
  • ME/CFS
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Adrenal Fatigue
  • Chronic Pain
  • Chronic Migraines
  • Ehlers-Danlos/Hypermobility
  • Idiopathic Hypersomnia
  • Pyroluria
  • Gastroparesis
  • Endometriosis
  • Lyme Disease
  • POTS and Dysautonomia
  • Hypo and Hyperthyroidism
  • Food and Histamine Intolerance
  • Depression
  • Bipolar Disorder
...and many others.

Funding Breakdown

IndieGoGo funds will...
  • Let us hire our developers full time to complete the app
  • Cover server costs for the upcoming year of operation
  • Go toward IndieGoGo fees and taxes

Timeline

Closed beta (early access): February 2014
Launch: May 2015


    Risks & Challenges

    We are developing Flaredown on our own time and money, so we need resources to pay for servers and keep our developer working full time on this project. This campaign will cover us for the first year of operation, and we will add a way to donate to the project once it is up and running. We will be very transparent about Flaredown's resources as it develops.


    Get Involved

    • Share! We need your help to get the word out.
    • Bloggers: see our press page.
    • Mobile developers: help us extend to users on iOS, Android, and beyond.
    • Medical researchers and data scientists: talk to us about the data.
    • Involved in the patient community? We need advocates from different illnesses to help us understand and support each one the best we can.

    Get in touch at contact@flaredown.com
