story:
(Hey, my friend!  Check back soon for a video highlighting this campaign but for now, please read about this cause below!  Also stay tuned as I will be adding additional great campaign perks.)

The people want fitness. The people need fitness. But sometimes the people can't always get the fitness they want and need because barriers get in the way.  Barriers like a lack of access, lack of qualified and educated help, and a glut of confusing, conflicting, and thus unreliable information...

Hi and aloha! I'm Levon, and I am the founder, owner, and lone ranger fitness professional at Superhuman Fitness, a exclusively mobile fitness training company on the island of Oahu in Hawaii. I span the island on a daily basis to provide lower cost fitness services to my personal training clients and group fitness  classes at local parks, beaches, and in their own homes.  I also provide highly effective and personalized training services to clients worldwide through follow-along video training programs and 1-on-1 training and consultation video conferencing sessions.  I also love learning and spreading my knowledge as much as I can through writing and I maintain a regularly published free fitness newsletter and have a couple of different fitness-related books in the works as well.  I LOVE what I do and I see myself and the way I interact with and influence my people as a breath of down-to-earth fresh air in a largely shallow, self-centered, look-at-me fitness industrty.  We go against that grain at Superhuman Fitness with the mantra of “Real. Good. Fitness.” and I will cough up a lung and then some in my quest to create a “WOW” type of experience and level of service that my clients won’t find anywhere else, and all at a cost that they won’t find anywhere else.  This is my #1 goal! 

I also have another goal and a big dream. I sincerely look at everyone I encounter with thoughts like, “I wonder if he needs my help” and “what could I do to help her live a healthier life?”  I’ve never been a “I want to change the world!” kind of guy (I honestly think that’s the first time I’ve ever used that cliche), but I guess in a way I kinda do.  My goal is to help 1000 people by the end of 2014 successfully reach their health and fitness goals, or at least be well on their way to doing so by making and getting started on a solid plan of action that is begining to achieve measurable results.  I really, REALLY want to make this happen!  A lot of plans are in place, some are in motion, but more help is needed to get the Superhuman Fitness train really moving to help as many people as possible become more than they ever thought they could be.

But before I share those plans with you and describe how you can help, here’s a bit of my story...

In another life in the not too distant past, I was in medical school studying to become a physician.  I’ve always been physically active and had a strong interest in the functioning of the human body and so I wanted to do something that involved these interests.  Also, as an ultra committed and involved family man (more on that later), my strongest desire was to pursue a career that would allow me to be involved with my interests and helping people while providing the kind of income that would allow me to have a traditional home structure and opportunities for my kids’ growth and eduation.

Ultimately, however, this plan didn’t work out.  “Stuff” hit the fan while in my first year of medical school when I made some heartwrenching discoveries in my marriage.  Then the fan came off the ceiling when my wife at the time suddenly and without warning left our home, taking our two young children with her, and relocated to another island.  I won’t go into all the details of all that happened as I don’t feel like the airing of dirty laundry is healthy or helpful to anyone, but the end result of this sudden upheaval in my personal life was an inability to stay focused on my studies in medical school.  As a result, my grades plummeted and I was not allowed to continue in the curriculum, leaving me to bascially start my adult life over again from scratch! (Except it wasn’t really starting all over – private medical school education is anything but cheap and I’ve got the 6-figure student loan burden to prove it!)

So here I am now.  Thankfully, my struggles led me to do a lot of soul searching, if you will, and re-evaluating of my life and in which direction I would take it next.  Interestingly, I ended up going full circle in a way by coming back to doing something I’ve always loved and had a passion for but never really considered pursuing as a career – fitness.

Making it my own – I’ve been a certified fitness professional for almost 10 years now and involved in high levels of athletic competition and training for most of my life.  But for most of that time I’ve never been able to picture myself working in fitness as a full-time career, mostly because I’ve never been a fan of the typical gym atmosphere and I most certainly detest the stereotypical nature and perception in general of the fitness industry mentioned above.  But somehow, in the the middle of my struggles to find myself and what the next step in my life was to be, Superhuman Fitness was born and a continual evolution of doing fitness in a way that reflects me and my down-to-earth, common sense values has unfolded over the past 4+ years.  It’s exciting to create something that you feel makes an impact not just in the world but in the life of an individual human being!  I look forward to doing this for many years to come!

I’m hitting some roadblocks, however.  The aftermath of medical school student loans, not to mention a very long and drawn out contested divorce, has left me in a position of needing to do something really big in life to bring myself out of a pretty substantial hole while supporting myself and my children financially, but it has also led to not being able to grow my business in a way that most entrepreneurs would typically attempt (e.g. applying for a business loan).  I have fought hard to find and keep happy every client I’ve ever had the privilege to work with, scrimped and saved and been very creative in growing my very humble supply of fitness equipment, and have in general had to do pretty much everything in growing my business the long, slow and hard way.  It’s been rewarding, but it’s been a very tough road!

But this is where you can help.  The evolution of Superhuman Fitness has led to some really big ideas that I would like to implement in trying to help as many people as possible accomplish their fitness goals.  Here is some of my work, the services I offer, or will soon offer:

  • Highly personalized group and individual fitness training services on the island of Oahu.
  •  Additional online fitness support and training services to help on-island clients reach their goals.
  • Online check-in training via Skype and other services to help remote clients make and excute plans to achieve fitness goals.
  • An online, high-intensity, follow-along video system of exercise called ‘R:20’ which is focused on fat burning and getting fit in shorter, more condensed workouts that can be done virtually anywhere.  This also includes an ongoing interactive component with me as well as an online community made up of other subscribers to this system, worldwide.
  • An online exercise bank that provides hundreds of exercises and workout programs and templates for a small monthly subscription fee.
  • An additional workout program (downloadable or via DVD, haven’t decided yet) that centers around high intensity exercise using no-bounce medicine balls.
  • Electronic books I am in the process of writing centered on several fitness topics.
  • An idea for a new piece of fitness equipment that I would like to develop, manufacture and bring to the market (that’s all I can tell you about it for now!).

I speak out loudly in behalf of and seek those who don’t have access to fitness facilities and/or qualified fitness instruction and help.  Sometimes this barrier to access is cause by financial reasons, other times it is due to geography as is the case for some of my target areas on Oahu such as the Waianae coast and the Ko’olauloa area from Ka’a’awa to Kahuku, as well as the North Shore where there are little to no facilities or opportunities to work out.  However, I’ve also learned that access to the help people need isn’t always limited by just geography or finances – many people in all areas are kept from better fitness by barriers like the fear of bad experiences they’ve had at gyms with intimidating atmospheres.  I especially want to help those who fall into this category here in Hawaii, but as mentioned above, in 2013 I also began extending that reach worldwide through some of my online forms of training services, my free fitness and nutrition newsletter, etc.

The impact you will have by contributing to this campaign is tremendous.  As mentioned before, in lieu of a business loan, I am seeking funding to help build my business in the following ways:

  • As mentioned, my company is 100% mobile and a large part of the day to day concerns of my business is making sure that my transportation around the island of Oahu is highly reliable.  At some point I would like to be able to afford a hybrid or electric vehicle (dream car = Tesla!) to be as economical as possible as well as to be good to the environment, but for now anything that is reliable and somewhat economical will do!
  • In addition, I have a big place in my heart for people for whom access to qualitifed fitness help is extremely limited due to financial concerns and/or geography.  We have quite a bit of both not only here in Hawaii, but also worldwide, and as mentioned before, I want to help as many people as I can reach to succeed in living healthier lives!  Probably the biggest obstacle to reaching this population that I target is simply the investment in work, time, and money it takes to get my message out there and reach those who need it.  Simply stated, funding to accelerate advertising efforts is needed!
  • Although much of what I do with my clients during actual workouts centers around bodyweight-based workouts and functional movement training for better day-to-day living, an increase in my supply of training equipment I can bring with me to mobile training sessions would be a welcomed addition and would help attract and retain more clients and keep them motivated and excited about their fitness journey.
  • A major undertaking taking place in 2014 and beyond is to increase my business's community outreach.  So far, plans for this include "Lunch and Learns" where I provide a healthy lunch at workplace environments, community meetings, physician's offices, etc. and give informational workshops on various fitness and nutrition topics.  No strings attached, just free lunch and free helpful info!  Also in the works is what I call "Turbo Trash Pickup", which are events that are about like they sound - interested community members gather to pick up trash at local parks and beaches but in addition to the service we provide, we're doing so in a speedy way, getting a killer cardiovascular and core workout at the same time!  I hope to be able to fund and/or gain sponsorship for these events in providing refreshments/lunch after the activity.
  • Product development and refinement is another big cost in terms of time and money and this cost will continue to grow as I develop some of the tangible as well as fitness information products such as books and training programs mentioned above.

Perks!  I am very excited about the perks I have to offer contributors to this campaign in exchange for your help so please check those out!  Additional perks will be added soon.  In addition to the perks offered in this campaign, ALL contributors, regardless of the amount donated, will receive a personal thank you email from me as well as named recognition on my website as a Superhuman Fitness sponsor (unless you'd rather not and choose otherwise - please let me know).

My ‘Why’ - Something I learned a while back from one of my mentors is that if you want to accomplish a really big goal, you need a strong enough ‘why’.  I teach this same concept to my clients and anyone else I can influence as they strive to reach their fitness goals.  For me personally, I have a couple of different ‘whys’ that fuel me in what I’m doing – obviously one of these is my goal to achieve this “Help Count” of at least 1000 people in 2014, but affecting me even more deeply and moving me to act is the desire and privilege I have as a father to care for my two young children, age 8 and 5.  You see, in the course of my messy divorce in which the main issue contested was custody of the children, I lost that battle and the sole reason given was the fact that at the time of trial, my ex-wife had a larger and more steady income and better living quarters (don’t get me started on all the other factors that make this decision so maddening!).  I have always been an extremely involved and hands-on type of dad, even through the years of graduate and medical school, so for me this has been a most difficult pill to swallow.  As a result of the legal proceedings and that fact that my children live with their mother most of the time on a separate island in Hawaii, I don't get to see my children nearly as often as I would like or that I feel that they need.  Children need their fathers!  At the same time, however, the fact that finances were the sole determining factor when custody was determined also means that I have an opportunity and great power to change this custody situation through changing my financial circumstances.  This is what I’m working hard at accomplishing through my efforts as a fitness professional and entrepreneur.

As an educated and qualified fitness professional, I view what I know and what I do with that knowledge as a social obligation, and that if I don’t spend the days of my life trying to convey and help as many people as possible utilize that information to their benefit, then I am not pulling my weight in society and the space I occupy in it is basically just a wasted one!  So I ask you today to please help me to help others and bring Fitness to the People!  Mahalo (‘thank you’) for your time and support!

story:
JIM GREENLEAF IS HOME FROM HIS SURGERY! 

Why does it sometimes take the most challenging of circumstances to learn the meaning of Christmas? For our family, the understanding of Christmas comes in the form of a very scary realization. Yesterday, we got a call that our Dad went to the hospital with gangrene and part of his foot was amputated. Our Dad, Jim Greenleaf, has been through a lot in his life... 

 

Many of you who know him, or have known him (through his work) may have memories about our Dad that are far better then what is written here. For those of you who don't know him, here is a little back story. He has had many injuries and accidents in the past and all of them have brought him to a new chapter in his life. As a young man, James (like so many others) dreamed of pursuing a career as an actor. He also realized that he should invest in the more practical study of his craft so he applied and received a full-ride scholarship to the University of Idaho for theater. Shortly after his time there he broke his leg severely enough and had to quit college to heal and rehabilitate himself. During this intervening time, he lost his scholarship and couldn't afford to return to College. This left him asking all kinds of questions about his future. At the time the only viable solution seemed to join the Navy as a journalist - which he did. The experience taught him discipline and determination and gave him a real sense of purpose and understanding the value for living life to the fullest. He was later honorably discharged and began to re-imagine his future as an actor so he moved to Hollywood to pursue the next "stage" of his life.  
 
His first appearance was on the Gong Show, where he performed a skit of a ping pong match in slow motion. This got the attention of Norman Lear, who called him, and gave him his "big break". Seeing the potential in him, Norman gave him a lead role in his show "All the Glitters". He was a hit, and the doors blew open. He was cast in movies and in guest starring roles on TV, and at the time people recognized him where ever he went.
 
A well known celebrity by the age of 25, on his way to becoming one of the most sought out comedy Actors in the 80's, starring in hit TV shows like "Laverne and Shirley", and "Mork and Mindy", in blockbuster hits, like "Night Shift", and unforgettable films, with co-stars like Matt Dillon and Denzel Washington. He later received a lead role in a Sunday morning cartoon series on NBC, everything seemed to be going great. At the height of his career, he got in a terrible car accident that changed his life and our family forever. As kids, we heard that he was first pronounced dead at the scene. That moment everything changed. But miraculously our Dad came back to life and after two years in the hospital, he made a remarkable recovery. The surgeons performed a never-before-done surgery rebuilding his hip with titanium chains and screws and he underwent rigorous rehabilitation to learn to walk again. Since then he has faced every struggle with optimism attempting to turn every opportunity into a positive and hope-filled situation. Although, he would never reach the level of stardom once anticipated after this life altering accident; he managed to work in a variety of capacities, honing his skills as a character actor, doing stand-up comedy and working odd jobs to pay the bills along the way. 
 
Our Dad loved to play basketball, and with his new limitations he became an even bigger fan from the sidelines. Unable to be as active as he once was he had to come to terms with the effects of a body that needed constant care and attention. With the onset of diabetes and other diseases caused by slowing down of circulation, he has been on a slow and lengthy journey to rediscover health and himself. He was recently married to Marva who believes in him and has helped him to manage a healthy lifestyle, since being married he has lost a lot of weight and he has been healthier than he had been for many years.  
 
One great passion of his emerged over the past several years - his role as Santa Clause. During this time, thousands of people around the world, have come to appreciate his 'Santa' character and the wisdom he shares in this new role. Jim speaks about diabetes and healthy living all in the context of 'Santa'. With an online presence and occasionally playing 'Santa', Jim and Marva have worked together as Mr. and Mrs. Clause, a jolly couple, bringing joy to kids and families worldwide. This Christmas, Jim and Marva were contracted to be in New York playing the roles of Mr. & Mrs, Clause once more. For five hours each day, they would help each child that visited feel special and intently listened to, and of course kids would get their picture taken. Unfortunately, they were unable to complete their stay. We learned recently that our Dad got a cut on his toe which would not heal a few days ago. Being diabetic this was the first sign he was in trouble. Coupled with a flu like cold, the two made a tough decision to leave New York early and come back home. 
 
When they arrived two days ago it was clear that something was very wrong. There was a smell coming from his foot that was overpowering and James knew he had to see a doctor right away. When they visited the doctor, they were given a hard blow. They were told it was gangrene and that he needed to go immediately to the hospital...that was 2 days ago. They are still in the hospital today waiting to be given a room. They doctors say that they will have to amputate. As you can imagine this came as really hard news for our Dad and family. So many unanswered questions arose. Now we are wondering what the quality of his life will be from now on? How will he manage to take care of himself and one another? How will he work and pay his rent?
 
There is one thing that stands out for us as a major blessing. It is the outpouring of love and support from our friends and family. In the midst of all this our Dad reminded us to simply 'believe'. So, we do, but we are struggling to see how he will be cared for along the way with all that is before him. It is overwhelming. We are hopeful to see and experience the best the human spirit has to show in the way of love, support and generosity through prayers and outpouring of compassion. Already we have received notes of encouragement and people have offered prayers and good wishes. Christmas to us, is exactly this!
 
Unfortunately, for Jim and Marva they were relying on the money they were going to make from their contract in New York to pay their bills this Holiday season. Now, there is a very real struggle to figure out how they will get by. They are too proud to ask for money themselves. So, this is why our family is appealing to the many people whose hearts 'Santa' has touched over many years in a positive way, to show their best wishes and blessings this holiday season. It is not easy for us to be this open and vulnerable about their circumstances, but we trust 'you' and believe that when people come together to help and serve each other in love, miracles can happen.
 
Words can't describe the deep sadness we are feeling for our Dad right now. We are still shocked and have not even had time to grieve yet. But it is more important for us to tell his story and to invite you to consider helping our Dad this Christmas Season.  
 
Here is what the money will go toward...
 
To help with their bills (rent, utilities, minor medical costs) which would have been paid for if they were able to complete their contract in New York. Becuase of the amputation and rehibilitation, they will need help meeting those needs this Holiday Season.
 
We know that every little bit helps, so thank you in advance for your generous help, which is a Christmas Miracle!

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Will you please help to word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
JIM GREENLEAF IS HOME FROM HIS SURGERY! 
Why does it sometimes take the most challenging of circumstances to learn the meaning of Christmas? For our family, the understanding of Christmas comes in the form of a very scary realization. Yesterday, we got a call that our Dad went to the hospital with gangrene and part of his foot was amputated. Our Dad, Jim Greenleaf, has been through a lot in his life... 
 

Many of you who know him, or have known him (through his work) may have memories about our Dad that are far better then what is written here. For those of you who don't know him, here is a little back story. He has had many injuries and accidents in the past and all of them have brought him to a new chapter in his life. As a young man, James (like so many others) dreamed of pursuing a career as an actor. He also realized that he should invest in the more practical study of his craft so he applied and received a full-ride scholarship to the University of Idaho for theater. Shortly after his time there he broke his leg severely enough and had to quit college to heal and rehabilitate himself. During this intervening time, he lost his scholarship and couldn't afford to return to College. This left him asking all kinds of questions about his future. At the time the only viable solution seemed to join the Navy as a journalist - which he did. The experience taught him discipline and determination and gave him a real sense of purpose and understanding the value for living life to the fullest. He was later honorably discharged and began to re-imagine his future as an actor so he moved to Hollywood to pursue the next "stage" of his life.  
 
His first appearance was on the Gong Show, where he performed a skit of a ping pong match in slow motion. This got the attention of Norman Lear, who called him, and gave him his "big break". Seeing the potential in him, Norman gave him a lead role in his show "All the Glitters". He was a hit, and the doors blew open. He was cast in movies and in guest starring roles on TV, and at the time people recognized him where ever he went.

 

A well known celebrity by the age of 25, on his way to becoming one of the most sought out comedy Actors in the 80's, starring in hit TV shows like "Laverne and Shirley", and "Mork and Mindy", in blockbuster hits, like "Night Shift", and unforgettable films, with co-stars like Matt Dillon and Denzel Washington. He later received a lead role in a Sunday morning cartoon series on NBC, everything seemed to be going great. At the height of his career, he got in a terrible car accident that changed his life and our family forever. As kids, we heard that he was first pronounced dead at the scene. That moment everything changed. But miraculously our Dad came back to life and after two years in the hospital, he made a remarkable recovery. The surgeons performed a never-before-done surgery rebuilding his hip with titanium chains and screws and he underwent rigorous rehabilitation to learn to walk again. Since then he has faced every struggle with optimism attempting to turn every opportunity into a positive and hope-filled situation. Although, he would never reach the level of stardom once anticipated after this life altering accident; he managed to work in a variety of capacities, honing his skills as a character actor, doing stand-up comedy and working odd jobs to pay the bills along the way. 
 
Our Dad loved to play basketball, and with his new limitations he became an even bigger fan from the sidelines. Unable to be as active as he once was he had to come to terms with the effects of a body that needed constant care and attention. With the onset of diabetes and other diseases caused by slowing down of circulation, he has been on a slow and lengthy journey to rediscover health and himself. He was recently married to Marva who believes in him and has helped him to manage a healthy lifestyle, since being married he has lost a lot of weight and he has been healthier than he had been for many years.  
 
One great passion of his emerged over the past several years - his role as Santa Clause. During this time, thousands of people around the world, have come to appreciate his 'Santa' character and the wisdom he shares in this new role. Jim speaks about diabetes and healthy living all in the context of 'Santa'. With an online presence and occasionally playing 'Santa', Jim and Marva have worked together as Mr. and Mrs. Clause, a jolly couple, bringing joy to kids and families worldwide. This Christmas, Jim and Marva were contracted to be in New York playing the roles of Mr. & Mrs, Clause once more. For five hours each day, they would help each child that visited feel special and intently listened to, and of course kids would get their picture taken. Unfortunately, they were unable to complete their stay. We learned recently that our Dad got a cut on his toe which would not heal a few days ago. Being diabetic this was the first sign he was in trouble. Coupled with a flu like cold, the two made a tough decision to leave New York early and come back home. 
 
When they arrived two days ago it was clear that something was very wrong. There was a smell coming from his foot that was overpowering and James knew he had to see a doctor right away. When they visited the doctor, they were given a hard blow. They were told it was gangrene and that he needed to go immediately to the hospital...that was 2 days ago. They are still in the hospital today waiting to be given a room. They doctors say that they will have to amputate. As you can imagine this came as really hard news for our Dad and family. So many unanswered questions arose. Now we are wondering what the quality of his life will be from now on? How will he manage to take care of himself and one another? How will he work and pay his rent?
 
There is one thing that stands out for us as a major blessing. It is the outpouring of love and support from our friends and family. In the midst of all this our Dad reminded us to simply 'believe'. So, we do, but we are struggling to see how he will be cared for along the way with all that is before him. It is overwhelming. We are hopeful to see and experience the best the human spirit has to show in the way of love, support and generosity through prayers and outpouring of compassion. Already we have received notes of encouragement and people have offered prayers and good wishes. Christmas to us, is exactly this!
 
Unfortunately, for Jim and Marva they were relying on the money they were going to make from their contract in New York to pay their bills this Holiday season. Now, there is a very real struggle to figure out how they will get by. They are too proud to ask for money themselves. So, this is why our family is appealing to the many people whose hearts 'Santa' has touched over many years in a positive way, to show their best wishes and blessings this holiday season. It is not easy for us to be this open and vulnerable about their circumstances, but we trust 'you' and believe that when people come together to help and serve each other in love, miracles can happen.
 
Words can't describe the deep sadness we are feeling for our Dad right now. We are still shocked and have not even had time to grieve yet. But it is more important for us to tell his story and to invite you to consider helping our Dad this Christmas Season.  
 
Here is what the money will go toward...
 
To help with their bills (rent, utilities, minor medical costs) which would have been paid for if they were able to complete their contract in New York. Becuase of the amputation and rehibilitation, they will need help meeting those needs this Holiday Season.
 
We know that every little bit helps, so thank you in advance for your generous help, which is a Christmas Miracle!


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:


Will you please help to word out and make some noise about our campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
